This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku , for the amount of 20,000.00 MZN with which she intends to buy materials for the construction of her house (stone, iron, sand, cement and others). Her previous loans were for 10,000 MZN, 15,000.00 MZN and 20,000.00 MZN which she also used for her dwelling.

She commits to duly paying off her loan and in future aims to build a commercial establishment because currently she uses a rented one, for which she intends to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her home; rocks, sand, cement, iron

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Las Joyas, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 
El socio  es el Sr. Alejandro ; el socio  tiene  71 años de edad y es casado  y tiene 3 hijos, El socio  es jubilado del ministerio de la región Inca y ahora se encuentra apoyando y ayudando a su esposa que tiene su stand en el mercadillo de restaurante ellos tiene un pequeño stand y venden comidas caseras, el socio ayuda a poner los cubiertos, la servilleta y a atender mientras la esposa cocina y sirve los diferentes paltos. El socio desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de insumos para implementar el stand y comprar productos como arroz, aceite, carne entre otros y continuar creciendo.
El socio  está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Señor Alejandro is a member of the communal bank "Virgen del Carmen" (Our Lady of Mount Carmel), which is located in the district of Las Joyas in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Alejandro is 71 years old, married and the father of three children. He is a retired government employee from the Inca region, and now he supports and helps his wife in their market stall, where they sell home-cooked dishes. Alejandro lays the table, cutlery and napkins, and serves the food, while his wife is cooking and preparing the various plates.

Alejandro wants to invest his loan in food ingredients for the restaurant. He will buy rice, oil, meat, etc. and keep on expanding his business. He is happy for the loan and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients, such as rice, oil, meat, etc. and to keep on expanding his business.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El Trabajo administrativo requiere de grandes esfuerzos y dedicación por lo delicado de sus operaciones ya que con ello se determina los resultados que rigen los destinos de una empresa, por eso el señor Juan tiene esa gran responsabilidad ya que tiene ese cargo en la panadería de su mama en la localidad de telica con 13 años de servicios en la misma, pero él tiene una necesidad básica y quiere efectuarla antes que entre la época lluviosa de mejorar su vivienda, por eso
El acude a Ceprodel porque requiere solicitar un crédito para el mejoramiento de su humilde vivienda y para ello comprará Cemento, Arena, Pintura, Rodos, Brochas, Thinner y Mano de Obra,  Esto con el fin de iniciar el mejoramiento de su vivienda que tanto lo requierepara beneficio propio y familiar.
texts.en:
Administrative work requires great effort and dedication because of the sensitivity of the operation, which determines the results that control the fate of the company. Juan has this great responsibility since he is in charge of the bakery owned by his mother. It is located in the town of Telica and has provided service there for the last 13 years.  

He has a basic need to make an improvement to his home, that he wants to complete before the rainy season begins. This is the reason he came to Ceprodel, to take out a loan for the improvements to his humble home. He will buy cement, sand, paint, paint rollers, brushes, paint thinner and pay for labor. This will be used to make improvements to his home which will be a great benefit to him personally as well as his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, paint, paint rollers, brushes, paint thinner and pay for labor.

loans.name: Donathe

texts.en:
Donathe is a widow who has been a rice farmer for nine years. She would like to obtain a Kiva loan in order to buy fertilizers and seeds and to support labor costs so as to ensure the best possible harvest. She has no children as yet.

With the profits, she plans to expand the land area she has been using, allowing her to achieve a greater output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and seeds and to support labor support costs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married with eight children with ages between 3 and 16. Three of them go to school. She has been a rice farmer for 1 year. She would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand her planting area to get more output.The people behind Agnes in the picture are her fellow borrowers. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and seeds and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Amancio De Abreu

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 1 filha maior de idade. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais um neto que vive com ele.

É motorista na Ara sul há mais de 30 anos e tem um salário de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (chapas, barrotes, ferro, areia, cimento, e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, 18.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, que usou para habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e comprar uma viatura, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Armancio de Abreu was born in the district of Boane, Province of Maputo, South of Mozambique, he's married and the father of 1 daughter who is of age. He completed the 6th grade and didn't continue his education due to his parents' lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his family and supports one grandson who lives with him.

He has been a driver at Ara Sul for more than 30 years and has a salary of 4,500.00 meticals (MZN) which he uses for household expenses and some of which he saves in his bank account (BIM).

He has never had loans from other banks and came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 20,000.00 MZN, with which he intends to purchase materials for the construction of his house (metal sheets, beams, iron, sand, cement and others).  His previous loan were for 10,000.00 MZN, 18.000.00 MZN and 20.000.00 MZN, which he also used for his dwelling.

He commits to duly paying off his loan and in future aims to complete the construction of his house and buy a vehicle, for which he intends to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: To buy metal sheets, iron, sand, cement, and beams for his house

loans.name: Manuel Rafael

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su madre y una hija, él es ganadero trabaja en sus tierras, se dedica a esta actividad por que le agrada el trabajo con los animales y la tierra, no tiene un horario establecido y logra mantener los gastos del hogar por los ingresos que recibe de esta actividad.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de dos vaquillas para agregarlas al ganado que tiene, esta compra le ayudara para aumentar la ganadería que tiene, el préstamo le dará la oportunidad de crecer.
La aspiración de Manuel es mejorar su ganadería, tener mayor numero de vacas, con el préstamo aspira tener una buena inversión y cancelar oportunamente el préstamo.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his mother and a daughter.  He is a cattle farmer, and he works his fields.  He devotes himself to this business activity because he likes working with the animals and the land.  He does not have a fixed schedule.  He manages to keep up with the household expenses with the income he receives from this business activity. 

He is requesting a loan to buy two heifers to add to the livestock that he has.  This purchase will help him to increase the livestock that he has.  The loan will give him the opportunity to grow.

Manuel’s aspiration is to improve his livestock and to have more cows.  With the loan he strives to have a good investment and to repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 39 years old, comes from Nakuru, and is a single lady. She runs a nursery school and has applied for her first loan to enable her to buy seats and tables for her students.


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. She hopes to develop the nursery school into a primary school.

loans.use: To buy seats and tables

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase  is married with three children aged between 3 and 7. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 20 years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay for support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and pay for labor

texts.en:

Eseta needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment, which are quite expensive in Samoa. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 210 WST per week) to improve her plantation and increase her harvest.

In 2012, Eseta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Eseta's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick would have accumulated bills he might not have been able to pay as owner of Accurate Investments, Inc. without the assistance of an ACCION Texas loan, he said. He applied for an ACCION Texas loan to cover the slow months from December through February.

The La Fayette franchise of parent company Pest Stop, a do-it-yourself pest-control store, is run by Patrick who is also district manager of four Pest Stop locations.The store sells professional pest control products that are not regularly sold in department or household stores.

Since 1977, Patrick has been an entrepreneur as he owned three used car lots after working at as a bank manager straight out of college. “I had the entrepreneur bug,” he said. From a car salesman to selling pest control items is a wide gap, but Patrick said he saw an opportunity to earn income while holding a leadership role, so he took it.

Patrick has owned his store since Aug. 2010, employs one person as a manager, and does not foresee hiring anyone else.

loans.use: To pay rent.

texts.en:
Kaloline, age 43, has a small plantation business, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has two years of experience in this business. Kaloline and her husband have four children.

She is requesting a loan of WST $1,250 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

Kaloline joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Kaloline's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment to grow taro

loans.name: Saloma

texts.en:
Saloma is 45 years old and married with one child. She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting fruit & vegetables for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business.    Saloma needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to continue improving her land and increasing output.

In 2012, Saloma joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Saloma's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment to grow fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Leuga

texts.en:
Leuga is 32 years old and married with five children. She owns & operates a small business venture, selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business. Leuga  needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2012, Leuga  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Leuga 's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional snacks to sell in her community

loans.name: Ailua

texts.en:
Ailua is 35 and married with three children. She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business.    Ailua needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2012, Ailua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ailua's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for growing taro

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Trep One Construction & Project Management Company has been in business since 1985. Its owner, Nathan, is a second-generation contractor with more than 25 years of experience in the construction industry. 

After Hurricane Katrina, Nathan was confident that the construction industry would be booming and that his business would be inundated with various projects. However, many residents who were desperate to return to their homes as soon as possible hired cheap labor instead of skilled and licensed contractors like Nathan. 

Nevertheless, Nathan’s business is prospering and he still believes that the New Orleans business community is very tight-knit, which makes it unique. Nathan is very optimistic about the future growth of his company as he hopes to one day have 10 full-time employees. 

Nathan is very grateful for the Kiva program as he believes he would not have been able to get financing elsewhere because of previous health issues.  Nathan will use his Kiva loan for advertising, contract bidding software, and working capital for materials and supplies.

loans.use: To pay for advertising and to purchase software and materials.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 21 years old and married with one child. She owns & operates a small business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.    Esther needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 250 talas per week) to continue improving and expanding her business.

In 2012, Esther joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Esther's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make fried foods

loans.name: Toafa

texts.en:
Toafa is 30 years old and married with three children. She owns & operates a business venture, selling specialty food products in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.    Toafa needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 280 talas or US $117 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2012, Toafa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Toafa's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food products for sale

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona, age 33, lives in Balanlinao, Plaridel, with her husband and three children. She has a grocery store business and earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month. 

She has a requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 to purchase boxes of sardines and noodles, sacks of sugar, and a dozen assorted shampoos to offer for sale.
 
Jona has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Jona hopes to save more toward the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of sardines and noodles, sacks of sugar, and a dozen assorted shampoos to offer for sale

loans.name: Tiuana Telesia

texts.en:
Tiuana Telesia is 37 years old and married with 6 children. She owns & operates a business venture, selling dried goods in the local community.  She has 1 year of experience in this business.    

She needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas per week) to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

In 2012, Tiuana Telesia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried goods to sell.

loans.name: Seneuefa

texts.en:
Seneuefa, age 49, prepares and sells food items in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience in years business. She and her husband have eight children.

Seneuefa is in need of a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase additional cooking ingredients. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas per week) to financially support the immediate members of her family.

Seneuefa joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Seneuefa's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients so as to prepare and sell her food products

loans.name: Argentina Azucena

texts.es:
Argentina separada, sus hijos mayores le ayudan en algunos gastos del hogar, su oficio hoy en día es comerciante de frutas y verduras ambulantemente en su carretón. Sus planes es mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda para ofrecerles a sus hijos comodidad y seguridad. Con el préstamo anterior compro un caballo que fue de gran beneficio al venderlo.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción como: Laminas de zinc, perlines, golosas, soldaduras entre otros materiales para iniciar la construcción del cuarto en donde vive con sus hijos. Así poco a poco ir levantando las paredes y todo lo necesario para tener una casa digna y segura.
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de sus planes y proyectos. Para optar a un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Argentina is separated. Her older children help her with some of the household expenses. Her trade nowadays is selling fruit and vegetables as a street vendor, in her cart. Her plans are to improve the infrastructure of her house to offer her children comfort and security. With the previous loan, she bough a horse, which really benefitted her when she sold it. 

She is asking for the loan to buy construction materials such as: zinc sheeting, beams, soldering material and other materials to start construction on the room where she lives with her children. This way she can get the walls up little by little and do everything necessary to have a safe and worthy house. 
She is thankful to the bank for the support it has given her as she develops her plans and projects so that she can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Faasao Majorina

texts.en:
Faasao Majorina is 29 years old and married with 2 children. She owns & operates a small bakery.  She has 1 year of experience in this business. She needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase additional inventory & to use as working capital. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to supplement her family's income.

In 2012, Faasao Majorina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to build up inventory and supplies for her bakery business.

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina is 57 and married with 5 children. She owns & operates a business venture, selling ice cakes (flavored ice frozen in cups).  She has 1 year of experience in this business.    Filipina needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2012, Filipina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to buy new items to expand her business.

loans.name: Likilini

texts.en:
Likilini is a 58-year-old widowed mother of five children. She owns and operates a small business, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Likilini needs a loan of 1,500 Samoan talas to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 350 talas per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2011, Likilini joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Likilini's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa has managed a retail store for more than four years. She is thankful because through her hard work she is able to make her business grow. She is married and has two children who go to school.

Marissa would like to increase her profit to be able to sustain her family's needs and to support her children's education. To make her goal come true she is asking for additional capital in the amount of PHP25,000, allowing her to buy more stock merchandise for her retail store. Through this loan amount, she would be able to satisfy her customers' demands and economize her transportation expenses in going to and from the market. 

She knows that she could obtain her goal because of the big impact of her requested loan. Marissa hopes that all the KIVA lenders would continue to support her financially in order to have a productive business that enables her to improve their way of living and to save some for the bright future of her two children.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her retail store.

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita is 51 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store.

She has borrowed and paid back 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from cell phone repair. She wants to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Tafagamanu

texts.en: Tafagamanu is 49 years old and married with 4 children. She has a small plantation where she grows and harvests a variety of crops such as taro for sale. She has one year of experience in this business. She is asking for this loan of WST 1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment to make it easier to gather crops for sale. This is her first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Emily requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish for making dried fish for her business. She has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish for making dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Menierva

texts.en:
Menierva is 60 years old and married with 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of products to sell.

She has borrowed and paid back 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from buying and selling gasoline. Menierva aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of products to sell.

loans.name: Vilma Rosa

texts.es: Vilma de 59 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena; ella es viuda y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 31 a 40 años. Desde hace 29 años que falleció su esposo, (quien tenia una colmena en el mercado de esta ciudad,  donde vendía ranchos y víveres), debió asumir la responsabilidad de sus hijos, ella cerró este negocio y se dedicó a la venta de mercancía variada como prendas de oro, de plata y ropa en general, con su negocio logró sacar a sus hijas adelante porque le fue muy bien y esto fue por el apoyo que recibió de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización de la cual ha recibido 17 créditos durante 14 años, con este apoyo su vida ha cambiado mucho,  así como su negocio que era muy pequeño y solo tenia uno, pues hoy también genera ingresos mediante su microempresa de comidas rápidas y empleo; ella tiene vitrinas y sus ingresos han aumentado, generándole mejoramiento en su nivel de vida. Como su clientela es creciente requiere permanentemente capital de trabajo para ser muy oportuna y poder responderle; por eso su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para lograrlo, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, crédito Numero 18 que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con  el cual comprará materias primas para la elaboración de su comidas rápidas,  como salchichas, pan mortadela, quesos entre otros insumos, así mismo planea invertir también en mercancías como prendas de ora y plata sobre los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes. Su experiencia de trabajo en sus dos microempresas y la gran acogida que tiene su negocio en el sector, potencializan una inversión exitosa y generadora de mas ingresos para seguir fortaleciendo el bienestar propio y el de su  familia.
texts.en: Vilma is 59 years old. She lives in the city of Cartagena. She is a widow with four children aged 31 to 40 years old. Since her husband died 29 years ago (he had a store in the market where he sold prepared food and groceries), she had to assume responsibility for her children. She closed his business and started to sell various merchandise in the city such as gold and silver jewelry and general clothing. With her business she was able to get her daughters ahead because it went very well for her. This is because of the support she received from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She has received 17 loans from this organization over 14 years. With this support her life has changed a lot. Her business was very small and she only had one, and now she also generates income and jobs with her microbusiness selling fast food. She has display cases and her income has increased, generating a better quality of life for her. Since her clientele is growing, she requires permanent working capital to be able to respond quickly. The working capital she has is now insufficient and that is why she is turning to a Kiva loan, her 18th loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy materials to make her fast food such as sausages, bread, baloney, cheese and other ingredients. She will also invest in merchandise such as gold and silver jewelry to fill orders her customers have made. Her work experience in her two microbusinesses and the popularity her businesses have in the area make this a potentially great investment that will generate more income to keep fortifying her own wellbeing and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to prepare her fast food, such as sausages, bread, baloney, cheese, and many more ingredients. She also plans on investing in merchandise such as gold and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
El municipio de Telica se caracteriza por tener varios colegios y por tener muy buenos maestros tanto de educación primaria como de secundaria. El señor Jorge  labora como Director en un colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 16  años, es casado se traslada de telica a su centro de labores en una comunidad del municipio en conjunto con todo su cuerpo educativo.
Ceprodel se ha caracterizado por apoyar a muchos maestros con el crédito para que puedan desarrollarse y seguir trabajando en la educación de los niños y jóvenes y es por este motivo que el señor Jorge actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de Cemento, Ladrillos, Hierro 3/8, Hierro Liso, Piedrín y Mano de Obra, por este motivo espera que el crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente, para el mejoramiento de su vivienda y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The municipality of Telica is known for its various schools and for having very good teachers in both primary and secondary education. Jorge serves as Director in a municipal school, dedicating himself to this work for some 16 years. He is married and moved from Telica to his work center in a community of the municipality together with its entire educational body.

Ceprodel is known for helping many teachers with loans so that they can advance themselves and continue working to educate children and young people. It is for this purpose that Jorge is currently soliciting a loan to buy cement, bricks, 3/8” iron rods, smooth iron sheeting, and gravel, and to hire laborers. He hopes that his loan will be granted satisfactorily, so that he can make improvements in his house and his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, 3/8" iron rods, smooth iron sheeting, and gravel, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Deodora

texts.en: Deodora is 57 years old and married with 5 children. With one child in school, Deodora works very hard to provide for them. She runs a tobacco retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of other items as well. In the future Deodora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Aipaa

texts.en: Aipaa is 54 years old and married with 4 children. She has a small plantation where she grows a variety of crops, such as taro, for sale. She has 1 year of experience in this business. She is asking for this loan of WST 1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment to make it easier to harvest her crops. Such equipment is often very expensive in Samoa due to high import costs. This is her 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 39 years old and married with children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. She has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, milk, sugar, coffee, sardines, etc. In the future, Emily would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a very responsible husband and father. He is 43 years old and he is married to Myrna, 40 years old. They are blessed with two children.  Melowin, 20 years old, is a second year college student, and Eron, six years old, is already studying in their village. Wilson is doing his best to provide for the needs of his family.  One of his goals is to send their children to school. 

Wilson has been managing a store and a bakeshop in their village. He has been in this kind of business for two years.  He always wanted to grow his business further, however availability of sufficient capital hinders him. He hopes to get a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to be used as his additional working capital for his retail business. The loan will be a big help for the progress of his business, so he prays that lenders will give him the opportunity of improving his general store and bakeshop.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices, drinks and flour for his store

loans.name: Zusima

texts.en:
Zusima is fifty-four years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Zusima has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for ten years. She has requested a loan for 8,000 to buy stocks of bananas and coconuts to sell.

Zusima has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Zusima hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Nahun Arturo

texts.es:
Nahun, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo en productos agrícolas como abono y herbicidas, tambien semilla mejorada, ya que está iniciando su nueva siembra y con este aporte podrá tener los insumos necesarios para realizarla. 
La producción de Nahun ha sido mejor, el comenta que obtuvo buena cosecha, aumentando su potencial como agricultor y los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Nahun is requesting a new loan to buy agricultural products such as fertilizer and herbicide and also improved seed as he is beginning to sow for the new season and, with this input, he will have the supplies he needs to get started.
Nahun's production has been better and he says that he got a good harvest which increased his potential as a farmer and his family's income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide.

loans.name: Xochitl Azusena

texts.es:
Xochilt, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que considera que con este aporte su negocio ha mejorado, actualmente comprara un pedido de frutas frescas, como bananos, fresas, melón, papayas, piñas, tambien comprara verduras. 
Ella tuvo un efecto positivo en sus ventas después de la inversión del préstamo, ya que surtió el negocio, su familia se encuentra bien, sus condiciones económicas se mantienen.
texts.en:
Xochilt is requesting a new loan, as she believes that this support has improved her business. Now, she will buy an order of fresh fruit such as bananas, strawberries, melons, papayas, pineapples, and she will also buy vegetables.

She has observed a positive effect on sales following her investment loan, which she invested in her business. Her family is well, and she is maintaining her economic standing.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruit such as bananas, strawberries, melons, papayas and pineapples.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is sixty years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Emelia is making and peddling snacks like rice and cheese cakes. She has had this business for ten years. She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks .

Emelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is from the village of Cabisera 27.  She is fifty-three years old and married with eight school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita raises pigs to fatten and sell. She has been engaged in her business for over three years.  She is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Carmelita believes that through hardworking and patient you can achieve what you want.

Carmelita hopes that some day she will be able to build a piggery to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: En el municipio de Telica departamento de León, La señora María se dedica a impartir clases como maestro de primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 23 años, es Viuda con 1 hija a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo, ya que está estudiando el tercer año de la carrera de Ingeniería Acuícola, Una de las necesidades que la  señora  María atraviesa, es de mejorar el sumidero, Baño e Inodoro de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones, por lo que se decidió  de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Bloques, Cemento, Arena, Piedrín , Inodoro y Mano de Obra para realizar las mejora en la casa como esta descrito anteriormente, para brindarle  mayor seguridad de su vivienda. Ya que esto le ayudara a darle mayor seguridad a su hija
texts.en:
In the town of Telica in the department of Leon, Maria works giving classes as a primary school teacher in a small school in the town.  She has been doing this work for 23 years.  She is a widow with one daughter who she tries to give the needed conditions for her development, since she is in her third year of studies in aquaculture.  

One of the needs that Maria has is to improve the drains, bath and toilet in her house since they are in poor condition.  Because of this she decided to turn to Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase construction materials like concrete blocks, cement, sand, gravel, a toilet and labor to complete the improvements in her house as described above.  This will bring more security to her house.  This will also help her give better security to her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase concrete blocks, cement, sand, gravel, a toilet and labor

loans.name: Yenis

texts.es: Yenis tiene 32 años de edad y con ella 3 hermosos hijos en las edades de 7 a 14 años, por los que día a día, se esfuerza con tal de lograr que alcancen su éxito futuro y esto es su mayor desafío. Ella emprendió su negocio de vender mercancía mediante financiamientos de alto costo realizado a particulares. Con su gran esfuerzo logró salir adelante y posteriormente se asoció a su prima, con quien emprendió una tienda de tienda de ranchos víveres en un local comercial donde también existe un servicios de telecomunicaciones mediante la venta de minutos a celulares. Poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo y así mismo su clientela, ellas gradualmente han incorporado entre sus líneas de productos mercancías variadas como cubrelechos ropa sabanas etc.  Posee una clientela exclusiva y vende permanentemente, lo cual hace que su capital de trabajo se torne insuficiente para lograr responder a su demanda, esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, crédito con el cual comprará víveres en mayor volumen, mercancía variada que tiene encargada como artículos de cocina y cubrelechos. Su éxito radica en su experiencia con la clientela y que está basada en los pedidos que estos hacen y en su comportamiento  histórico respecto a las ventas y promociones.
texts.en:
Yenis is 32 years old and has three beautiful children of ages 7 to 14. She strives every day for them to achieve future success, which is her greatest challenge. 

Yenis first started her business of selling merchandise with high-cost financing. With her great effort she managed to succeed and then partnered with her cousin, with whom she started a general store selling provisions. They also offer telecommunications services through the sale of credit minutes for cell phones.
 
Gradually, their business grew along with their clientele. They have gradually built up their product lines and stock varied goods as clothing, comforters, sheets etc. They have an exclusive clientele and they are constantly selling, which means that their working capital has become insufficient to meet customer demand, which is precisely the reason for requesting this credikiva.

This loan will be invested to buy food in larger volumes, and various merchandise such as cookware and bedspreads. Her success lies in her experience with customers, and is based on the their requests and their historical behavior with respect to sales and promotions.

loans.use: to buy food in larger volumes, and various merchandise such as cookware and bedspreads.

loans.name: Patricia Marisol

texts.es:
Patricia, necesita un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo en el negocio, comprara juguetes, peluches, arreglos florales, ropa para niños y adultos, esta inversión la realiza con la intensión de mejorar sus ventas, atrayendo a más clientes para que compren de sus mercaderías.
Ella considera que con la ayuda de estos préstamos es como ha logrado mejorar el negocio, incrementando sus inventarios de variedad de productos, las circunstancias familiares están mejorando, tambien sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Patricia needs a new loan to invest in her business. She will buy toys, stuffed animals, floral arrangements, clothing for children and adults. She is making these purchases with the goals of improving her sales and attracting more customers to buy her goods. 
She believes that these loans have helped her to improve her business, gradually increasing the variety of goods she offers. Her family circumstances have also improved as has her income.

loans.use: to buy toys, stuffed animals, floral arrangements, clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa has a tailoring and dressmaking business and she works hard to support her family. She has been in her business for 15 years now. She and her husband have three children.

She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more linens, thread, and other materials for her business.

In the future, Felisa would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more linens, thread, and other materials for her tailoring and dressmaking business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is thirty-seven years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Analiza has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Analiza has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Analiza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Zonia Maribel

texts.es:
Zonia, quiere un nuevo préstamo porque está interesada en aumentar el negocio, ya que sus clientes le demandan productos nuevos, por eso comprara ropa nueva para damas y caballeros, como camisas, blusas, ropa interior, tambien comprara frutas frescas para hacer los refrescos naturales. 
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo en el negocio, aumentando sus ventas y los clientes, tambien considera que los ingresos son mejores.
texts.en:
Zonia is requesting a new loan because she are interested in growing her business. Her customers are demanding new products, so she will buy new clothes for men and women, including shirts, blouses, and underwear. She will also buy fresh fruits to make natural drinks.

Zonia has observed a positive effect on her business through increasing sales and customers, also believes that her revenues have improved.

loans.use: to purchase clothes including shirts, blouses, underwear.

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque considera que la atención de la institución es buena, además que estos préstamos le ayudan mucho a cubrir sus necesidades, él continúa realizando las siembras agrícolas, por eso utilizara estos fondos para comprarse abono y herbicidas para aplicarlos al nuevo cultivo.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para que realizara su trabajo agrícola, obtuvo buenas cosechas y con ello le ayudo a su familia.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan because he believes that the support of the institution is good, and also that these loans are very helpful to him in covering his business needs.

He continues to work in his agriculture business growing crops, so he will use these funds to buy fertilizer and herbicides to apply to his new crops.

José believes that the previous loan helped him to make his farming business succeed - he achieved a good harvest which helped him to help his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Fanny Yaneth

texts.es:
Fanny, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque quiere comprarse más productos para el negocio, compra refrescos y gaseosas, tambien maíz, aceite, chicharrón, quesillo, para mejorar la disponibilidad y aumentar la producción.
Ella considera que estos préstamos son importantes, para el desarrollo de comerciantes como ella, el anterior le permitió tener lo insumos necesarios para la venta, ha crecido en cuanto a clientes y espera seguir en esta dirección.
texts.en:
Fanny is requesting a new loan because she wants to buy more products for her business.  She will buy soft drinks, other beverages, corn, cooking oil, pork rind, and farmer's cheese so that she can have more products available and increase her production.

Fanny considers these loans to be important for the development of merchants like her.  Her previous loan allowed her to have more supplies on hand for her business, and as a result her business has grown and she has more customers.  She hopes to continue to make this kind of progress.

loans.use: to buy corn, cooking oil, pork rinds and farmer's cheese

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Josie has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 9,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Josie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Josie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Jesus, Jr.

texts.en:
As a single man, Jesus, Jr. works hard to support his family. 

He has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Jesus, Jr. is borrowing 29,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts and materials for his motorcycle transport business. 

Jesus, Jr. has been sustaining his business activities through the past four loans from NWTF. He hopes that he hard work will help his attain his dream to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional spare parts and materials for his motorcycle

loans.name: Jonavie

texts.en:
Jonavie is 27 years old, married, and has three children. 

Jonavie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. 

Jonavie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending and selling frozen products. 

Jonavie aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an ambulant business selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.Lourdes has been in this business for two years. Lourdes earns more income from raising pigs and selling rice.  

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Marvelin

texts.en:
Marvelin is thirty-seven years old, and is a hardworking and positive person. She is married and raising two children. She is involved in a hog fattening business. Besides this, she is also involved in buying and selling AVON, MSE and NATASHA products. She has been in these businesses for five years and luckily gained enough experience to promote her business successfully.

Marvelin  is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy pigs and feed as well more of the branded products she sells. She hopes her business will improve thanks to the loan, and that she will be able to better her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed as well as branded products to sell.

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Annabella requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other materials for fishing. She has been in this business for four years.

Annabella would like to save enough to provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Adelaida is forty-nine years old and two of her children are in school.

Adelaida has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Adelaida requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Adelaida has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza, age 35, earns her living through a fishing business. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has been engaged in her business for four years. She and her husband have five children, four of whom are enrolled in school.

Riza has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF, which she will use to buy tools and equipment for her fishing business.

In the future, Riza would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a coconut lumber business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more lumber to sell.  Jesselyn has been in this business for 2 years. Jesselyn earns additional income from a sari-sari store business.  Jesselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more lumber to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has one child.  Cristina has a shop that sells bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for 2 years. 

She requested a loan for 7,000 to buy stocks of bananas & coconuts to sell.  Cristina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Cristina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas & coconuts to sell

loans.name: Lilieni

texts.en:
Lilieni, age 26, owns a small business venture preparing and selling food products in her community. She has one year of experience in this business. She and her husband have one child. 

Lilieni will use this loan of WST 1,000 in order to purchase ingredients to make food products for sale. She will use the profits to improve and expand her business, and support her family. 

This is her second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make food products to offer for sale

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia works hard to support her family. She is married and sells raffia fibre in the Philippines. 

Sylvia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy buli (buri palm) to make raffia fibre to sell. She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Sylvia would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy buli to make raffia fibre to sell.

loans.name: Wenelita

texts.en:
Wenelita is thirty-eight years old, married and has two children in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Wenelita has a firewood sales business in the Philippines. Wenelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy firewood and charcoal to sell.

Wenelita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Wenelita would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Adis Luz

texts.es: Adis vive con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos de 11 a 20 años de edad.  Su iniciativa productiva a través de un negocio, la inició con la venta  ropa en las líneas de damas, caballeros e infantil; posteriormente fue enfocándose por la oferta de productos de belleza mediante guías especializadas y su negocio empezó a crecer, pues sus hijas también empezaron a participar en él, ayudándola  en la promoción de su mercado. En la actualidad quiere agregar nuevamente la línea de ropa, pues últimamente ha tenido pedidos entre su mas firme clientela y desea complacerlos para sostenerlos fieles, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva en  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues con este capital aumentará sus posibilidades de comprar de contado y en mayor volumen,  ganado descuentos y adquiriendo  exactamente la mercancía que sus clientes  han solicitado. Con esta inversión potencializa su éxito, porque conoce el mercado, es apoyada por sus hijas y además porque ganará descuentos y será oportuna con su  clientela. Su meta mas adelante es tener un almacén especializado en ropa y productos de belleza, bien ubicado en un punto comercial moderno y de gran concurrencia de potenciales y reales clientes y este sueño es el motor que impulsa su trabajo diariamente y justamente su gran desafio.
texts.en:
Adis lives with her spouse and has 4 children between 11 and 20 years old.  She works in a business that she started with the sale of clothing in women's, men's and children's lines.  Later she focussed on offering beauty products through specialized guides and her business began to grow.  Her children also started to participate in the business, helping her in the promotion of her market.

Currently she wants to add to her clothing line, since lately she has had requests from her best customers and she wants to please them to keep them faithful.  This is why she requested her Kiva loan in the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, since with this capital she will increase her chances of purchasing in greater volume, getting discounts and acquiring exactly the merchandise that her customers have requested.  

This investment will enable her success, because she knows the market, is helped by her daughters and because she will get discounts and be responsive to her customers.

Her goal in the future is to have a shop specialized in clothing and beauty products well located in a modern commercial area, with a large potential audience and cash clients and this dream is the motor that moves her daily work and is her great challenge.

loans.use: to purchase women's, men's and children's clothes in greater volume.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
En el municipio de Larreynaga Malpaisillo en un poblado del  departamento de león, la señora Marisol se dedica arduamente  a laborar como Cajera de un centro de salud  de la comunidad, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 24 años, es Casada con 3 hijos a su cargo, a los  que tiene que proporcionarles  las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen, 
Una de las necesidades que la señora Marisol  atraviesa hoy en día es de Mejorar su vivienda, la que se encuentra en mal estado, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión sabia de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de Materiales de construcción como: Cemento, Arena, Bloques, Clavos y Mano de Obra, para Reparar su vivienda y tener mejores condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Larreynaga Malpaisillo, in a village in the department of León, Mrs. Marisol works hard as a cashier in a community health center. She has been doing this job for 24 years, and she is married with 3 dependent children. She must provide them with the necessary conditions for their development.

One of the needs that Marisol currently has is to improve her home, which is in poor condition. Because of this need, she allowed herself to make the wise decision to visit Ceprodel and request a loan with which to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, blocks, nails and labor so that she can repair her home and achieve better living conditions and standards.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, blocks, nails and labor

loans.name: Tania Carolina

texts.es:
Tania, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque quiere seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, comprando productos frescos como pescado, camarones y otros mariscos, ya que la demanda esta buena y quiere mantener la disponibilidad económica para mejorar su negocio.
Ella considera que el préstamo le ha mejorado su condición en el negocio, que ha logrado aumentar las ventas y los ingresos familiares.
texts.en: Tania is requesting a new loan because she wants to continue investing in her business, buying fresh products like fish, shrimp, and other seafood.  Demand is good and she wants to maintain her economic availability to improve her business.  She believes that her previous loan helped her to improve the condition of her business.  She has increased sales and family income.

loans.use: to purchase  fish, shrimp, and other seafood.

loans.name: Uanona

texts.en:
Uanona is 25 years old, married, and has two children.  She runs a small business selling food products from a food stall.  She has three years of experience with this business.  

Uanona would like this loan of 1500 Tala (WST) to help her buy ingredients to make her goods.  She will use the profits from her sales to improve and expand her business and support her family.  This is her third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food products for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old, married, and has five children, one of whom is in school.  Josephine works very hard to provide for them.  

Josephine sells tobacco and requested a 16,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional tobacco to sell.  

Josephine has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items such as tobacco leaves.  

In the future Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
"Hard work and patience have been the characteristics of business women" says Cynthia. She is married to Roberto, and they have been blessed with eight children who are grown up and settled in marriage already. She is thankful because, although her children have their own families, still they are helping her to improve her business.

Cynthia has been engaged in a clothing business where she offers different kinds of blouses, pants, jackets and other kinds of dry goods.  She has run her business since 1990.  One of her strategies in running her business is changing the products she offers, because it has a great impact in increasing her profit.  Nowadays, she plans to offer clothing such as blouses, pants, formal dress and other dry goods fitted to this month.  However, her income is not enough.  So she is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P30,000. She hopes that she can get this amount of loan to be able to satisfy her customer demands and obtain greater profit to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, formal dresses and other dry goods for her clothing business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is forty-two years of age, a very hard-working person who is devoted to her family. She has a general store, selling biscuits, soft drinks and household commodities. She also built a small eatery business. She did this in order to generate enough income to support her household, where she lives with her husband and five children.

These businesses are Teresita’s source of income so she makes good strategies and techniques every day to be able to provide her family a better quality of life.

Now she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 as additional working capital to purchase groceries such as sugar and oil. It will also be used to buy foods to cook in her “carinderia” (eatery). She just hopes to acquire more customers to appreciate her products. This would allow her to earn a higher income that would lift her family out of poor living.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as sugar and oil.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is fifty-two years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Vivian has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy stock for the store and raw ingredients to make viands.

Vivian has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Vivian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for the store and raw ingredients to make viands.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en: Sheryl is twenty-nine. She is still single and is a very hardworking bachelor. She is aiming to make a good life for her family so for this reason, she is in the business of retail. She sells cosmetics and beauty products at the market. She wants to experience a better life before she settles into married life. To achieve this goal, she is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase perfumes, lotion, make up and powder. These new products will attract clients and provide her with a good income. She hopes to obtain a comfortable lifestyle as she achieves her goal in her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lotion, make-up and powder.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita, she 52, is engaged in a manicure and pedicure business in her village. She is a very responsible wife and mother from the village of San Antonio. She and her husband have four grown-up children. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy materials that she can use in her business. 

Merlita hopes that someday she can set up a parlor stall in their village that will be more convenient to her customers. She also wishes to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials that she can use in her manicure and pedicure business

loans.name: 010318-Thôn Bắc Sơn-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga, age 29,  operates a food stall restaurant business, selling fish. She has been engaged in her business for four years. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to prepare and sell. She and her husband have one child. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 010318-Thôn Bắc Sơn-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women this year in order to improve her business. Nga has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nga hopes for her business to do well, to buy a cell phone, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish to prepare and offer for sale in her food stall

loans.name: Mario Alcides

texts.es:
Mario, necesita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de semilla mejorada para el cultivo, tambien quiere aprovechar el préstamo para invertir una parte en la compra de láminas para el techo de la vivienda.
El considera que estos préstamos son de mucha ayuda, el anterior le ayudo para comprarse los insumos agrícolas, ahora espera que esta nueva deuda le ayude a seguir mejorando.
texts.en: Mario needs a new loan in order to invest in the purchase of improved seed for planting.  He also wants to take advantage of the loan in order to invest part in the purchase of corrugated plates or zinc sheets for the roof of his home.  He thinks that the loans have been of great help.  The previous one helped him to purchase agricultural products, and now he hopes that this new loan will help him to continue improving.

loans.use: To purchase improved seed and corrugated plates or zinc sheets for the roof of his home.

loans.name: Marta Gladis

texts.es:
Marta, es solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, debido a la demanda de los clientes, sus productos se han agotado, por eso comprara carne, pollo, arroz, chicharrón y maíz, para el negocio, con estos materiales tendrá abastecido el negocio para seguir produciendo sus alimentos a los clientes.
Su interés por seguir trabajando con préstamos es porque considera que con este aporte lograra mejorar sus ingresos, y crecer en el negocio.
texts.en: Marta seeks this new loan to invest in her business, to satisfy client demand since her products have sold out.  For this reason she will buy meat, chicken, rice, pork rind and corn, to keep her business well stocked and with food available for her customers.  She hopes to continue working with micro credit as she feels it will help her increase her sales and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, rice, pork rind and corn

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es:
Zoila, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras para el negocio, con la intensión de tener productos frescos, como repollo, tomates, papas, papayas, manzanas, peras, entre otros productos. Ella considera que el trabajo con este préstamo le ha dado mayor seguridad para atender a los clientes, mejorando sus ventas.
Ella espera con esta nueva inversión mejorar los ingresos para la familia.Este es su segundo prestamo.
texts.en: Zoila seeks this new loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her business, to have fresh produce available, such as cabbage, tomatos, potatoes, papayas, apples, pears, etc. She feels that this loan has given her greater security in serving clients and increasing her sales.  She hopes that this new investment will increase her family's income.  This is her second micro loan.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, tomatos, potatoes, papayas, apples, pears.

loans.name: Ada Maria

texts.es:
Ada, tiene la intensión de surtir nuevamente el negocio, por eso está solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar la compra de  zapatos, sandalias, camisas, blusas, ropa interior, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar la atención a los clientes, dándole mayores oportunidades de venta.
Ella manifieste haber tenido una buena experiencia con el préstamo anterior, que su condición de comerciante ha mejorado al igual que sus ingresos, este es su cuarto prestamo que invierte.
texts.en: Ada wants to restock her business and is seeking a loan so that she can buy shoes, sandals, shirts, tops, and underwear.  These purchases will allow her to improve the care she gives her clients, giving her more opportunities to sell.  She reports that she had a good experience with her previous loan and that her condition as a trader has improved as has her income.  This will be her fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, t-shirts, tops, and underwear.

loans.name: Adelio

texts.es:
Adelio, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita realizar el arrendamiento del terreno para la nueva siembra de maíz y frijol, por eso recurre nuevamente a estos préstamos, ya que le dan el recurso económico necesario para poder realizar su trabajo.
El préstamo anterior le permitió realizar la compra de materiales agrícolas para aplicarlos a maíz y frijol que tenía sembrado, ayudándole a tener mejores buenas cosechas.
texts.en:
Adelio is seeking a new loan because he needs to pay the rent on the land that he has planted with a new crop of corn and beans.  This is the reason he has come back to ask for money: because such loans give him the economic means necessary to carry on with his work.

His previous loan allowed him to buy agricultural supplies for the corn and beans that he has planted, helping him achieve a better harvest.

loans.use: to pay rent on his land.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita, a widow with five grown-up children, owns and operates a grocery store business. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. 

Lolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock. 

Lolita is requesting a new loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase snack foods, drinks, noodles, and spices for her store. In the future, Lolita hopes that her business will sufficiently expand to allow her to help meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, drinks, noodles, and spices to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: 010313-Thôn Bắc Sơn-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết, age 36, owns a retail business selling electronics. She is requesting a loan to purchase electronics to offer for sale. She is the leader of a seven-member group, the 010313-Thôn Bắc Sơn-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She and her husband have two children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Tuyết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tuyết has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuyết has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tuyết faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Tuyết hopes to travel for vacation within the country, to buy land of her own, and to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase electronics to offer for sale

loans.name: 010401-Thôn Xuân Phụ-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương has a retail business selling medication. She is requesting a loan to purchase medicine to sell. Hương has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hương is twenty-eight years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependants.

Hương is the group leader of the 010401-Thôn Xuân Phụ-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2011, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

In the future, Hương hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to sell.

loans.name: Edith Johana

texts.es: Edith con su credikiva compró mecancia variada con la que aumentó sus inventarios y así mismos sus ventas y finales ganacias. En la actualidad quiere compartir la felicidad de estar esperando su primer hijo y ahora se esta postulando a un nuevo financiamiento para lograr fortalecer su negocio aun mas, por eso viajará a la ciudad de Barranquilla para comprar mercancias variadas a un mejor precio en mayor volumen y con ello disminuirá su precio de ventas.  Está muy motivada a seguir adelante con su negocio en vias de esperar a su hijo con mayor bienestar y por eso trabaja muy esmeradamente. Su meta mas adelante es convertirse en una proveedora de calzado ropa de vestir y de productos de belleza. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Le doy gracias a tos por su apoyo y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, por apoyarme en mi negocio y estoy segura que con su ayuda podré alcanzar mis metas."
texts.en:
With her Kiva loan, Edith purchased varied merchandise with which she increased her inventory and also her sales and earnings.  Currently she wants to share the happiness of expecting her first child and is now proposing a new loan to strengthen her business even more.  Because of this she will travel to the city of Barranquilla to purchase varied merchandise at a better price and in greater volume and with this decrease her prices.  She is very motivated to continue forward with her business hoping to provide her child with greater well-being and because of this she works very diligently.

Her goal in the future is to become a provider of footwear, dress clothes and beauty products.  Her message to the lenders of Kiva is: "I give thanks to all of you for your help and to the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo for helping me in my business and I am sure that with your help I will achieve my goals.

loans.use: to buy varied merchandise such as women's clothing, footwear, etc.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que quiere volver a invertir en el negocio, comprando más leña y maíz,  con estos productos tendrá lo necesario para aumentar la producción de tortillas en el negocio.
Ella considera que es a través de estos préstamos como ha ido superándose, ampliando y creciendo en la atención a los clientes, el prestamo anterior lo utilizo para la compra de productos para la tienda.
texts.en: María seeks a new loan to invest in her enterprise by buying firewood and corn, as these will allow her to increase production of tortillas for her business.  She feels that micro loans have allowed her to prosper and grow, allowing her to better satisfy her clients.  She used a former loan to stock products in her store.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo, porque está por iniciar el nuevo cultivo de maíz y frijol, para eso necesita arrendar el terreno, en el cual aplicara el dinero del préstamo, dándole la oportunidad de tener seguro el lugar donde cultivara.
El préstamo anterior se sirvió mucho, ya que compro los insumos para el cultivo que esta realizando en aquella fecha, ella es cliente con record de creditos.
texts.en: Ana has decided to ask for a new loan because she is about to start a new field of corn and beans.  In order to do this she needs to rent the land, which is how she will apply the money from her loan.  This will allow her to have for certain the place where she will cultivate.  The previous loan served her very well, since she purchased the fertilizers for the cultivation that she is harvesting by deadline.  She is a client with a record of credits.

loans.use: to pay for the renting of land

loans.name: Rolando De Jesus

texts.es:
Rolando, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como abono, herbicidas e insecticidas, estos materiales le ayudaran para mejorar fortalecer el cultivo, permitiéndole tener mejores cosechas.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para tener lo necesario y trabajar como siempre en la agricultura, sus cosechas fueron de provecho y con esto tambien se beneficio su familia.
texts.en:
Rolando is seeking another loan to buy agricultural supplies, such as fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides.  These materials will help him to strengthen his crops, leading to better harvests.

He says that his previous loan helped him to get what he needed and to keep working in agriculture.  His harvests were plentiful, and he was therefore able to help his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José, tiene la necesidad de obtener un nuevo préstamo, debido a que su vivienda necesidad mejoras en el techo, este tiempo es propicio para realizar antes de la llegada del invierno, comprara cemento, lámina, para poder mejorar y evitar cualquier problema en el hogar.
El considera que ha tenido buena experiencia con el préstamo anterior, le ayudo tambien a invertir en la vivienda construyendo un cuarto y así mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan because he has decided that he needs to make improvements to his roof. This time of year is good for this work so it can be done before winter starts.  He will buy cement and sheet metal to improve his roof and thus avoid any problems with his home.

He says he had a good experience with his previous loan, which also helped him to invest in his home.  He built a bedroom and thereby improved his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cement and sheet metal.

loans.name: Damaso

texts.en:
Damaso is forty-five years old, and has an upholstery shop. This is his source of income and how he provides for his wife and two children.
