Она начинала бизнес с купли- продажи мелкого рогатого скота, а сейчас имеет несколько голов крупного рогатого скота. Имеет хороший опыт работы в данной сфере бизнеса и имеет хорошие условия на содержании скота. Мохира запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Mohira is a hardworking and good woman.  She is married and the loving mother of three children.  Her husband is a carpenter.  For over two years she has been selling cattle.  She began her business selling sheep and goats, but now she has several head of cattle.  She has She has valuable experience in this type of business and she has a good environment for keeping her cattle.  Mohira is requesting the loan to expand her business by purchasing cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to expand her business

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto, es soltero,  vive con sus padres, es agricultor, sembrando maíz, frijol y café, trabaja desde hace varios años, junto a su padre, inician labores desde las 6:00am hasta las 3:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para pagar mano de obra en la preparación del terreno y compra de semilla, abono y herbicidas, con estos recursos podrá iniciar el trabajo y tener lo necesario para que se realice el proceso correcto.
La aspiración de Roberto es ser independiente en sus cultivos, crecer y tener sus propias cosechas.
texts.en:
Roberto is single and lives with his parents. He is a farmer who grows corn, beans, and coffee. Roberto has worked for several years with his father. They begin their work at 6am and continue until 3pm.

He is requesting a loan to pay for labor for preparing the land, as well as pay for seeds, compost, and herbicides. With these resources, he will be able to begin his work and have what he needs to follow the correct process. Roberto aspires to work independently with his crops so that he can grow and have his own harvest.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to buy seeds, compost, and herbicides.

loans.name: Adau

texts.en:
Adau lives in Dokuru bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has two children; neither of them are still in school. 

Adau heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 1,200 in order to purchase fish for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in Dokuru bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has six children; two of them are still in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 1,200 in order to purchase fish for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Gelber Mauricio

texts.es:
Gelber, es agricultor, vive con su madre y sus abuelos, él está dedicado al cultivo de hortalizas, tiene tres años en esta actividad, siembra pepinos, tomates y chiles, trabaja a tiempo completo, aprendió este oficio por su abuelo.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra de semilla de pepino y compra de fertilizantes, con esta ayuda podrá iniciar la nueva siembra y aplicar lo necesario para ver la cosecha abundante. 
La aspiración de Gelber es aumentar la producción, tener clientes a quienes vender la producción de manera definida, tambien tener mayor terreno.
texts.en:
Gelber is a farmer who lives with his mother and grandparents. He grows vegetables and has been in this business for three years. Gelber grows cucumbers, tomatoes, and chile peppers. He works full-time and learned this trade from his grandfather.

Gelber is currently requesting a loan to use for buying cucumber seeds and fertilizers. With this assistance, he will be able to start a new crop and apply what he needs to achieve an abundant harvest. Gelber aspires to increase production and to have customers to whom he can sell what he produces on a regular basis. In addition, he wants to have more land.

loans.use: to buy cucumber seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, vive con sus tres hijos, es comerciante, tiene su negocio en el mercado desde hace 10 años, ofrece productos de la canasta básica, es reconocida por sus clientes y vecinos, ha logrado mantenerse en esta actividad ya que sus hijos dependen de ella.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de granos básicos y productos como, arroz, frijoles, café, cacao, aceite, azúcar, pastas, detergentes y jabón. Esta compra le ayudara para surtir el negocio y mantener los productos más necesarios para los clientes.
La aspiración de Ana es mantener el negocio por más tiempo, ampliarlo tanto en espacio como aumentar tambien los productos, realmente quiere un negocio con más rentabilidad para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her three children. She's in retail and she has run her business at the market for 10 years. She sells staple goods and she's well-known among her customers and neighbors. She has successfully kept herself in the business because her children depend on her.
She currently requests a loan in order to purchase basic grains and goods such as rice, beans, coffee, cocoa, olive oil, sugar, noodles, detergent and soap. This purchase will help her stock up her business and maintain the merchandise her customers need the most.
Ana wishes to keep the business going for longer, to expand it and to increase the merchandise. She really wants a more profitable business so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, coffee, cocoa, olive oil, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, se ha decidido a solicitar otro préstamo, porque quiere aumentar las ventas en el negocio, para eso comprara productos como tomates, cebollas, maíz, aceite, condimentos, y una parte de leña, para preparar tortillas y por las tardes pasteles y antojitos, ya que esto le ayudara a tener los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de los productos y en la leña al comprarla en efectivo le ayudara para encontrarla a menor precio.
Ella manifiesta haber tenido un efecto positivo del préstamo anterior, porque realizo la compra necesaria para mejorar la atención a los clientes en la venta de tortillas, la cual ha sido muy útil para que sus ventas aumentaran, con esta inversion quiere ofrecer un rubro mas a los clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca has decided to request another loan because she wants to expand her sales in her business.  She will buy products such as tomatoes, onions, corn, oil, seasonings, and a portion of firewood to make tortillas and, in the afternoon, meat pies and snacks.  This will help her have the necessary materials to make the products.  For the firewood, buying it in cash will help her get a better price.

She says the previous loan had a positive effect because she made the necessary purchase to improve her customer service selling tortillas.  This has been very useful for increasing her sales.  With this loan she wants to offer another line to her customers.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, corn, oil, seasonings, and firewood.

loans.name: Isaac Wamai

texts.en:
Isaac is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD., after repaying the previous loan successfully. Isaac will use the loan to purchase rice, sugar and maize flour for resale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to  buy rice, sugar and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, 30, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Nestor, an employee, and father to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elizabeth maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are making as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy merchandise and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elizabeth fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and it is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Arslon

texts.ru: Арслон трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Ему 30 лет. Более 3-х лет он занимается купле- продажей скота. В месяц 2-3 раза ездит на рынок и покупает скот. Откармливает в течении 15 дней  и снова продает на рынке. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход и постепенно улучшает свое благосостояние семьи. Арслон запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Arslon is a hardworking and conscientious man.  He is 30 years old and, for over 3 years, he has been fattening cattle for resale.  2 or 3 times a month he goes to the market and buys cattle.  He fattens them up over the course of 15 days and then resells them at the market.  He ears a good income from this business and little by little he is improving his family's well-being.  Arslon is requesting a loan to buy cattle with the goal of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de productos lácteos, como el queso, crema, cuajada, también helados, como el sorbete de varios sabores, paletas, conos, con esto estará mejorando la disponibilidad en él y poder generar mejores ingresos.
Ella comenta que el préstamo anterior fue un gran aporte, realizo una buena compra, dándole una mayor estabilidad.
texts.en:
Sonia is requesting a new loan to buy dairy products such as cheese, cream, and curd cheese, as well as ice cream, such as various flavors of sorbet, ice pops, and cones.  With this she will be improving her variety and be able to generate more income.

She comments that the previous loan was a great contribution.  She made a good purchase, giving her greater stability.

loans.use: to buy dairy products: cheese, cream, and curd cheese.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José, vive solo pero cerca de la familia, se dedica a atender un negocio de vidriera y ventanas, este negocio nació por la necesidad de tener una ocupación de la cual pudiera subsistir y cubrir sus necesidades.
Él  está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de vidrio de diferentes grosores, ya que es su principal material para hacer las ventanas solaires, que instalan sus clientes.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio a través de la ayuda de este préstamo, ya que es su principal objetivo tener un negocio más rentable.
texts.en:
José lives alone, but near his family. He manages a business that produces glassware and windows. This business was started out of necessity because he worried about how he would support himself and cover his needs.

José is requesting a loan in order to buy glass of varied thickness since this is the main material used for making windows that are installed in his customers' homes. His aspiration is to grow his business with the help of this loan. However, his main goal is to have a more profitable business.

loans.use: to buy glass of varied thickness.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La  señora   Francisca es cliente nueva que  vive en la ciudad de La Paz  que se dedica  a la comercialización de arroz por quintal vende en las ferias de  la ciudad de El Alto, se dedica a la venta de arroz desde hace ya varios años, el crédito en esta ocasión lo utilizara en  la  refacción y obra fina de su casa, y así  brindar mayor comodidad a su familia,  la señora francisca  esta pagando de manera puntual sus cuotas  ha demostrado responsabilidad hasta el momento ella se compromete  que seguirá  trabajando de manera responsable,  trabaja de manera  muy sacrificada  ya  que quiere salir adelante económicamente y mejorar sus ingresos y por ende la calidad de vida de toda su familia, se siente muy feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Francisca is a new client who lives in the city of La Paz. She sells rice by 100-kilo units in the street markets of the town of El Alto. She has been selling rice for many years. She will use this loan to refurbish and do finish work on her house in order to provide more comfort to her family. Francisca has been making her repayments in a timely fashion and has has shown responsibility so far. She pledges to continue working in a responsible way. She sacrifices herself a lot in her work, because she wishes to make financial progress and to increase her profits, and therefore improve her whole family's living conditions. She feels very happy and thankful for the opportunity she's been given.

loans.use: to refurbish her home.

loans.name: Najibullo

texts.ru: Начибулло активный и умный юноша. Он женат и пока не имеет ребенка. Более 4 лет он занимается купле- продажей авиабилетов. Для ведения своего бизнеса он сотрудничает с авиакомпаний «Алан». На данный момент Начибулло имеет 1 точку. Точка по продаже авиабилетов оснащена одним компьютером, двумя принтерами и железным сейфом. Бизнес налажен хорошо, так как месторасположение точки -  оживленная часть рынка. Большинство клиентов являются жителями района. Он также предоставляет компьютерные услуги: набор текста, распечатка, сканер файлов и ксерокопию. В районе очень большая конкуренция, так как он продает авиабилеты, по низкой цене имеет много постоянных покупателей. Начибулло запрашивает займ в размере 1500$ США для покупки основных средств, точнее: кондиционер, компьютер, стол и кресло.
texts.en:
Najibullo is a smart and energetic young man.  He is married but doesn't have any children yet.  For over 4 years he has been selling airline tickets.  In operating his business, he works in association with the airline company "Alan."  At the present time, Najibullo has one location.  It is equipped with one computer, two printers, and an iron safe.  Business is going well because his location is in a busy part of the market.  The majority of his clients live within his district.

He also offers computer services:  text layout, printing, document scanning, and photocopying.  There is heavy competition in his district, but since he sells tickets at low prices he has many regular clients.  Najibullo is requesting a loan of $1,500 to buy basic office equipment.  More precisely: an air conditioner, computer, table, and chair.

loans.use: to buy basic office equipment

loans.name: Maria Ramona

texts.es:
María, vive con su hija de 23 años y su esposo, la vivienda es propia, ella se dedica a labores agrícolas como la crianza de aves de corral y ganado, inicia sus labores de ama de casa ya tiende tambien la granja de aves, además le colabora a su esposo con el ganado, su ventaja es el terreno amplio, y su dificultad es al momento de la venta del ganado porque sus precios varían mucho.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de concentrado para el ganado, con esta compra le ayudara para mantener lo necesario y a menor costo, esta compra es verdaderamente importante porque en verano es cuando existe menos pasto para alimentar el ganado.
La aspiración de María es mejorar sus condiciones de vida, trabajar junto a su esposo, crecer en la ganadería y tener mejores opciones crediticias con la institución.
texts.en:
María lives with her 23-year-old daughter and her husband in a house they own. She's a farmer who raises barnyard poultry and cattle. She does the housekeeping work and also tends to the poultry farm. Besides, she also helps her husband with the cattle. Her advantage is the large plot of land, and her drawback is when it's time to sell the cattle, because the prices vary widely.
She requests the loan in order to purchase concentrated feeding for the cattle. This purchase will help her maintain what she needs at a lower cost. It is truly important because summertime is when there's less pasture for the cattle to feed on.
María wishes to improve her living conditions, to work alongside her husband, to expand the livestock business and to get better credit options with the institution.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feeding for the cattle.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Ernesto, de 40 años, tiene 21 años de casado, tiene 5 hijos de 20, 15, 12, 7 años y uno de tres meses de edad, tres de ellos estudian, vive en la colonia Buena Vista de Omoa, Cortes.
Don Ernesto, tiene un negocio de venta de refrescos y jugos, donde él vive es una propiedad a orillas de la playa, la cual cuida desde hace varios años, pero sus ingresos no son suficientes, entonces decidió poner un negocio de vender refrescos de botella y jugos para generar otros ingresos, el cual hace cinco años que lo tiene y atiende a sus clientes todo el día.
Esta solicitando su segundo préstamo para mantener surtido su negocio de refrescos de botella y jugos de donde obtiene otros ingresos para su familia. Tiene como meta darles una buena  educación a sus hijos para mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Ernesto is 40 years old and has been married for 21 years. He has five children (ages 20, 15, 12, 7, and 3 months), three of whom are in school. Ernesto lives in the subdivision of Buena Vista de Omoa, Cortes.

Don Ernesto has a business of selling soft drinks and juices. His property is located on the shores of the beach and he taken care of it for several years. However, his income was insufficient, so he decided to start a business of selling bottled soft drinks and juices in order to generate extra income. He has been in this business for five years and attends to his customers every day.

Ernesto is requesting his second loan in order to maintain the inventory of his bottled soft drink and juice business. This will enable him to generate income for his family. His goal is to provide a good education for his children so that they can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to restock his business with soft drinks and juices to sell.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is married and has four children aged between 1 and 13. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for one year. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers, seeds, and support labor costs.

loans.name: Nubia Yesenia

texts.es:
Nubia, vive con su familia, su hijo, una prima, sus abuelos, ella es madre soltera, se dedica a atender una tienda de productos domésticos, este surgió por iniciativa propia, trabaja en la casa de habitación, tiene experiencia en el manejo de este negocio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de bebidas como gaseosas, refrescos, jugos, gatorade, para surtir el negocio, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar el inventario y poder ofrecerles a los clientes variedad.
La aspiración de Nubia es que a través de los préstamos pueda crecer, ganando más clientela para así asegurar una mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Nubia lives with her family - her son, a cousin and her grandparents. She's a single mother who runs a domestic goods store, a business she started on her won. She works from home and she's got experience managing this business.
She currently requests a loan in order to purchase beverages such as soft drinks, refreshments, juices and Gatorade, so that she can stock up her business. This purchase will help her increase her merchandise and offer more varied goods to her customers.
Nubia wishes that the loans will allow her to grow and get more customers in order to ensure a more settled financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase beverages such as soft drinks, refreshments, juices and Gatorade.

loans.name: Yeddaly

texts.es: La Señorita Yeddaly tiene 21 años y es soltera no tiene hijos,  la Señorita se dedica a la venta  de varios productos (venta Ropa, DVD, celulares, etc.) su puesto de venta se encuentra en la zona  Norte de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, Este préstamo es la segunda secuencia dentro de la institución,  Yeddaly va a usar este préstamo para Capital de Trabajo (Compra de Mercadería ropa de temporada) Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es Hacer crecer el negocio. Yeddaly enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  La competencia del mercado y utilizara los beneficios para incrementar su capital de trabajo, mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida, con el tiempo desea comprar un lote de terreno, se siente muy feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es su única  actividad con la que se sustenta.
texts.en: Yeddaly is 21 years old.  She is unmarried and has no children.  She sells various products (clothing, DVD’s, cellular phones, etc.).  Her sales stall is located in the northern region of Santa Cruz.  This is her second loan with the institution.  She is going to use this loan for working capital (to purchase merchandise such as seasonal clothing).  She is requesting this loan to grow her business.  The challenge that she faces in her business is the competition in the market.  She will use the proceeds to increase her working capital, increase her income, and improve her quality of life.  In time, she wishes to buy a plot of land.  She is very happy and grateful to the institution for providing the financing as this business is her only means of supporting herself.

loans.use: to purchase merchadise (seasonal clothing and various products).

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirian, quiere surtir el negocio, por eso se ha decido a solicitar un préstamo  para la compra de semilla de marañón cruda, ya que es el producto que vende y quiere mantener la suficiente cantidad para prepararla y poder venderla.
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo en su negocio, con la utilización del préstamo anterior, ya que le dan mayor estabilidad en las ventas y para generar ingresos para las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Mirian wants to restock her business, so she decided to request a loan to buy raw cashew nuts. Since this is the product that she sells, Mirian wants to maintain a sufficient quantity so that she is prepared and able to sell.

The use of her previous loan has had a positive effect on her business. It has given her greater stability with her sales and the ability to generate income for family needs.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts.

loans.name: Rafael David

texts.es:
Rafael, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque está iniciando su cultivo de maíz con regadillo, y quiere comprarse los insumos agrícolas como el abono, herbicidas y pagar mozos para la preparación de la tierra.
Él ha tenido una experiencia positiva con el préstamo anterior, le ayudo a realizar el cultivo, sacando una buena cosecha de maíz para la familia.
texts.en:
Rafael is requesting a new loan to begin planting irrigated corn, and wishes to purchase farming supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides as well as pay workers to prepare the land. He had a positive experience with his previous loan.  It helped him to plant his crops and produce a good harvest for his family.  
.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides and pay workers.

loans.name: Celia Emelina

texts.es:
Celia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para fortalecer el negocio con la compra de maíz, frijol, pollo, arroz, azúcar, esto le ayudara para mantener el negocio bien surtido para así atender las demandas y necesidades de los clientes.
Ella considera que el negocio ha crecido, mejorando sus inventarios a través de la inversión que realizo anteriormente, esto le ayuda para que sus clientes se mantengan y le consuman de sus productos.
texts.en: Celia is requesting a new loan to strengthen her business with the purchase corn, beans, chicken, rice, and sugar.  This will help her keep the business well-stocked in order to meet her customers’ needs and demands.  She feels that the business has grown as she increased her inventory through the earlier investment she made.  This will help her keep her customers and maintain consumption of her products.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, chicken, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: May Flores

texts.en:
May Flores is 36 years old and has a small store in which she sells school supplies. She is a woman who is very competitive. 

Since 2007, with God’s grace, her business has been profitable continuously. But her everyday income isn't sufficient to maximize her business. To expand her business, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI to purchase additional school supplies for her store.

She knows that with her loan and very friendly characteristics, she will be successful in her business as well as in improving her quality of life very soon.

loans.use: to purchase additional school supplies for her store.

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Karina, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para el fortalecimiento del negocio, comprara ropa para niños y adultos, como blusas, faldas, ropa interior, con esta nueva compra  ayudara para mejorar la disponibilidad y mantener a los clientes satisfechos, ella ha cambiado el giro del negocio, porque anteriormente vendia frutas y verduras.
Ella considera que este trabajo con préstamos, le ha generado una mejor condición en su actividad de comerciante, manteniendo surtido el negocio y generando más ventas.
texts.en:
Karina has decided to request a new loan to strengthen her business. She will buy clothing for children and adults such as blouses, skirts, and undergarments. This new purchase will help improve the availability of her inventory so that she can keep her customers satisfied. She changed the focus of her business since she previously sold fruits and vegetables.

Karina believes that her work with the loans will result in a better condition for her as a merchant, as well as maintain the inventory of her business and generate more sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing for children and adults such as blouses, skirts, and undergarments.

loans.name: Zoila De Jesus

texts.es:
Zoila, está solicitando un préstamo porque quiere iniciar una nueva inversión en el negocio, utilizándolo para la compra de cosméticos (labiales, maquillajes, delineador), ropa como blusas, ropa interior de ambos sexos, la cual realiza la venta de forma ambulante.
Ella considera que ha tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, lo que la llevo a seguir trabajando, ya que de esta manera tendrá los recursos para su familia.
texts.en:
Zoila is requesting a loan because she wants to start a new investment in her business, using it to buy cosmetics (lipsticks, make-ups, eyeliner), and clothing such as blouses and underwear for both sexes, which she sells as a street vendor.

She feels that the last loan had a positive effect, which caused her to continue working because in this way she will have resources for her family.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, make-ups, eyeliner, blouses, underwear

loans.name: Agook

texts.en: Agook lives in Bor. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 29 year old, married and has four children – two of them are still in school. Agook heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para fortalecer el negocio, ya que quiere surtirlo de productos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, gaseosas, quesillo, condimentos, para que su tienda se vea más fuerte y con capacidad para atender las demandas de los clientes. 
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para que su negocio fuera mejor,  prestando el servicio con molino de nixtamal, mejorando las ventas y el servicio a los clientes.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan to strengthen her business because she wants to stock it with products such as rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, soft drinks, cheese, and condiments, so that her store will be stronger and have the capacity to attend to the demands of her customers.

She feels that the previous loan helped her business to be better, providing corn milling services and improving her sales and service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, soft drinks, cheese, and condiments

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has two children. Hasan has owned a shop for stationery, copying and typing since 2010. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers – he knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in surrounding areas.

Hasan is requesting a $1200 loan in order to purchase a photocopier and to add more items to his shop. He is aiming to gain more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopier and to add more items to his shop

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana, 54, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Edgar, her business partner, and they have three children. With her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Ana operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. Ana earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them individually. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ana hopes to expand her business soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married with four children between the ages of 9 and 16. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for four years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to support labor to get the best harvest. With the profit, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and seeds and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Oscar Alberto

texts.es:
Oscar, quiere invertir nuevamente en su negocio, por eso está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de sorbetes y paleras de diferentes sabores, ya que tiene demanda de estos productos y quiere mantener surtido para contar con la preferencia de los clientes.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo en el negocio, por eso se ha motivado a seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Oscar wants to invest once again in his business, so he is requesting a loan to buy sorbets and popsicles of different flavors. He already has demand for these products, so he wants to remain stocked in order to attract the favor of his customers.

Oscar believes his previous loan has had a positive effect on his business. For this reason, he is motivated to continue working.

loans.use: to buy sorbets and popsicles of different flavors.

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en:
Gaspard is married with six children between the ages of 1 and 20 years old. Five of them are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for nine years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and seeds as well as pay for support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and seeds as well as pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Juana Irene

texts.es: La señora  Juana es una cliente antigua de la institución, trabaja con emprender desde el año 2007, actualmente tiene dos créditos  en la institución uno de inversión y otro para capital de trabajo, la señora se  dedica a la venta de verduras por mayor en uno de los mercados más populosos de la ciudad de la Paz y vive en la zona Indaburo. El crédito  invertirá para adelantar a sus proveedores de verduras ya que ellos le venden por mayor,  La cliente se siente  beneficiada al ser otorgado el crédito Kiva. Juana  tiene  gran visión para  los negocios y quiere superarse  y fortalecerse con su  negocio que es la venta de  verduras  por mayor y de esta manera genera mas ingresos, mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de toda su familia se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is a long-time client who has worked with Emprender since 2007. She currently has two loans with Emprender, one for investment and another to use for operating capital. Juana sells vegetables wholesale at one of the busiest markets in the city of La Paz. She lives in the District of Indaburo.

This loan will be invested in an advance to her providers for vegetables that she can sell in bulk. She feels that she will benefit from the Kiva loan being provided. Juana has great vision for her businesses and wants to strengthen them so that she can succeed. Selling vegetables wholesale allows her to generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her entire family. Juana is pleased with and appreciative of this new opportunity presented to her.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Yovette

texts.en:
Yovette is married with three children aged 2-8. All are enrolled in school. Yovette has been a rice farmer for 1 year, and his wife also works as a farmer. Yovette is requesting this Kiva loan to pay for fertilizers, seeds, and labor support so he can get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to increase his output.

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending for agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds, and labor support.

loans.name: Maria Deysi

texts.es:
María, quiere seguir trabajando con préstamos, por eso está decidida a solicitar uno nuevo, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de elotes tiernos para la elaboración de tamales, tambien compara aceite, esto le ayudara para mantener lo necesario y continuar realizando sus ventas. 
Su condición familiar ha mejorado, el número de miembros sigue igual, ella considera que desde su préstamo ha logrado mantener un mejor equilibrio en su negocio.
texts.en:
María wants to continue working with loans, so she decided to request a new one. She will invest in the purchase of fresh corn for making tamales. María will also buy oil. This loan will help maintain her necessary supplies so that she can continue making sales. The condition of her family has improved and the number of members continues to grow.

Since receiving her loan, María believes she has been able to maintain better balance in her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh corn and oil.

loans.name: Papias

texts.en:
Papias is married with five children aged 6-16. All are enrolled in school. Papias has been a rice farmer for 1 year, and his wife also works as a farmer. Papias is requesting this Kiva loan to pay for fertilizers, seeds, and labor support so he can get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and renovate his house. The photo above shows Papias holding a Kiva form after filling it out. The other people you see are his fellow borrowers waiting to have their pictures taken for Kiva.

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending for agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds, and labor support.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel, solicita de nuevo otro préstamo con el objetivo de mejorar en su negocio de productos de primera necesidad, comprando azúcar, frijoles, aceite, sopas instantáneas, café instantáneo y materiales para la sastrería; hilos, agujas, botones, zíperes de esa forma lograra aumentar en sus ingresos.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para la compra de materiales para la sastreria y sus ingresos por los trabajos le ayudo para el sustento de su familia y apoyando el estudio de sus hijas.
texts.en: Miguel is requesting a new loan so that he can improve his business of selling basic necessities.  He will buy sugar, beans, oil, soups, instant foods, and instant coffee.  Miguel will also buy materials for his tailoring business such as thread, needles, buttons, and zippers so that he can increase his income.  He says that his previous loan helped him to buy tailoring materials and the income from his jobs have allowed him to support his family and provide for the education of his daughters.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, oil, soups, coffee, thread, needles, buttons, and zippers.

loans.name: Cinderella

texts.en:
To make a living, Cinderella manages a jewelry shop in the public market of Santiago. She is 52 years old and is married with 13 children. She is grateful because she is able to support her family's needs.

Cinderella would like to increase her profit so she can sustain her large family and improve their financial stability. She seeks to attain her goal through wise management, economizing her expenses for the family's daily needs by avoiding purchases of non-essentials, and asking for additional capital to improve her jewelry shop. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more fashion jewelry. This could enable her to earn a greater profit and thus improve the quality of her handmade fashion jewelry as well as satisfy customer demand. She hopes to obtain the loan amount requested to improve her family's standard of living, support her children's education, and save some money for emergencies.

loans.use: purchase more fashion jewelry for her retail business

loans.name: Marvin Mauricio

texts.es:
Marvín, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, es para la compra de productos para aplicarlos a la agricultura, como el abono e insecticidas, estos le ayudan para mejorar la producción, porque le fortalecen en el desarrollo y previenen de las plagas.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho, esto lo ha motivado a seguir trabajando, porque logro obtener una buena cosecha, esperando de igual manera será este nuevo  cultivo.
texts.en: Marvin is requesting a new loan in order to buy products to use for farming, such as compost and insecticides.  These items will help improve production because they will strengthen the development of his crops and prevent diseases.  Marvin says that his previous loan was a great help and it has motivated him to continue working so that he can achieve a good harvest.  He hopes to do the same with this new crop.

loans.use: to buy compost and insecticides.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudela. She is divorced with 3 children. 
Grace has a shop that sells clothes and dresses. She has had this business for 17 years. Grace requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase additional clothing materials.
Grace has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Grace hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing materials

loans.name: Viator

texts.en:
Viator is married with 6 children aged between 6 and 18. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 9 year. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and hire support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and cover labor support costs.

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.es:
Anselmo, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que en esta temporada de verano adquiere comida para el ganado, porque los pastos están secando, por lo que este préstamo lo necesita para la compra de comida preparada (concentrado o pasto picado), este le ayudara para realizar el gasto y poder tener la disponibilidad de comida.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar su condición de ganadero y agricultor, esto le permite tener una mejor condición.
texts.en:
Anselmo is requesting a new loan. Since this is the summer season, he wants to acquire feed for his cattle because the pastures are dry. With this loan, he will buy prepared food (concentrated feed or chopped grasses). The funds will help cover this expense and enable him to have available food.

Anselmo says that his previous loan helped to improve his condition as a rancher and farmer. As a result, he will be in a better state.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Novel

texts.en:
This is Novel, 49, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo, a driver, and is a mother to their five children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.   
                          
Novel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Novel hopes to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Prosper

texts.en:
Prosper is married with six children aged between 6 and 22. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 1 year. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay for support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and pay school fees for the children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers, and cover labor support costs

loans.name: Buenerge

texts.es:
Buenerge, está iniciando nuevamente los preparativos para la siembra, por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo la para el pago del alquiler del terreno, donde se dispone a sembrar maíz y frijol, este le ayudara para mantener la seguridad del sitio donde cultivara, del que espera obtener una buena cosecha.
Él comenta que con el préstamo anterior logro arrendar el terreno donde cultivo, que le sirvieron para que el cultivo le diera buenos frutos.
texts.en: Buenerge is starting the preparations for a new crop, so he is requesting a new loan to pay the rent on the farmland he is using for growing corn and beans.  This will help him secure the location where he farms in hopes of achieving a good harvest.  Buernerge says that his previous loan was used to rent the land that he farms, which helped him have a crop that resulted in a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to rent farmland for use.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Leus

texts.en:
This is Leus, 33, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Danilo, a clerk, and is a mother to their three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.        
                     
Leus operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Leus hopes to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Valens is engaged. He has been a rice farmer for 2 years. He is requesting this Kiva loan to pay for fertilizers, seeds, and labor support to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to increase his output.

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending for agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds and labor support.

loans.name: Emmanuel Antonio

texts.es:
Emmanuel, está soltero, vive solo, se dedica a la venta de helados, este negocio lo tiene desde hace dos años, lo aprendió de su padre, ya que es vendedor mayorista de helados, no tiene un horario fijo para atender dicho negocio.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de más productos como paletas, conos, vasitos, sorbete de varios sabores, la compra le ayudara para surtirlo y tener la mercadería para atender a la clientela.
La aspiración de Emmanuel es tener amplio el negocio, atender nuevos clientes y formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is single and lives alone. He sells ice cream and has been in business for two years. Emmanuel learned this trade from his father and now he is an ice cream wholesaler. He does not have a set schedule by which he manages his business.

Emmanuel is requesting a loan to buy more products such as popsicles, cones, cups, and sorbets of various flavors. This purchase will help restock his business so that he will have the merchandise that will allow him to serve his customers. He aspires to have a large business, attract new customers, and start his own family.

loans.use: to buy popsicles, cones, cups, and sorbets of various flavors.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram is a 43-year-old man. He is married and a father of four sons and five daughters. He is a school bus driver, who gets a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's costs.

For the past 20 years, Akram has also been selling clothes, which has been a profitable project.

Akram has a store for selling clothes in a high traffic area. He is requesting a loan from FATEN to help cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of clothes for sale. This will enable Akram to compete with others well and thus increase sales and improve the family's income. Akram is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of clothes for sale

loans.name: Mauricio Mardoqueo

texts.es:
Mauricio, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, ya que quiere mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda, comprando materiales para reparar el techo como Duralita, cemento, polines, y pago de mano de obra.
Este préstamo será un gran aporte, ya que él no cuenta con lo suficiente en ingresos para realizar esta inversión, en la ocasión anterior el invirtió en útiles para sus hijos, que tambien fue un gran aporte.
texts.en:
Mauricio has decided on a new loan since he wants to improve the conditions of his house by buying materials to repair the roof such as Duralite, cement, beams and paying for laborers.

This loan will be a great contribution since he does not have a sufficient income to make this investment. Earlier he invested in supplies for his sons, which also was a great contribution.

loans.use: to purchase Duralite, cement, beams and to pay for laborers.

loans.name: Nagham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 32 years old, married and has one child.

Nagham has been a tailor since 2005. She makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally such as suits, coats and dresses for women. She has more than four years of experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for an $1,800 loan in order to purchase two tailoring machines and an electrical generator. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase two tailoring machines and an electrical generator.

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es:
Rolando, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque ha iniciado el cultivo de maíz y frijol, y necesita pagar el alquiler del terreno donde se dispone a realizar la siembra, este dinero le ayudara para darle la seguridad de iniciar su labor agrícola.
El considera que se ha superado en su desarrollo de la agricultura, porque ha comprado los insumos necesarios  para realizar la siembra, la condición familiar se mantiene estable. Este es su segundo prestamo en la institucion.
texts.en:
Rolando is applying for a new loan because he has started cultivating corn and beans and needs to pay the rent for the land where he is ready to start planting. This money will help him acquire the security to start agricultural work.

Rolando feels that he has outdone himself in his preparation for farming because he has bought the supplies necessary to do the cultivation and his family situation is stable. 

This is his second loan with the institution.

loans.use: to pay to rent land for cultivation.

loans.name: Manar

texts.en:
Manar is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Ahmad appears in her Kiva profile photo. He is photographed in his grocery store.

Manar is a 36 years old woman, she is married and a mother with two sons. 
For the past five years, Manar's husband has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries.  It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover the family's costs.
Manar is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar. and milk, and to make improvements in the store's condition such as installing additional shelves. This will increase sales and increase the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of groceries for sale

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, es empleado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, su empleo es como fontanero en la alcaldía, su horario es de 8:00am a 4:00pm, de este trabajo ha logrado mantener a su familia.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la reparación del vehículo, ya que este le sirve para transportarse hacia su trabajo y además para su familia, este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar las condiciones del vehículo, ya que con su salario no alcanza para pagar la reparación. 
La aspiración de Manuel es que en su trabajo pueda perdurar, ya que la familia depende de él.
texts.en:
Manuel is employed and lives with his wife and two children. He is employed as a plumber for the city. His work schedule is from 8am to 4pm. This job enables him to support his family.

Manuel is requesting a loan for the repair of his vehicle since it serves as transportation to his job. In addition, his family uses the vehicle. This loan will help improve the condition of his vehicle since his salary is not enough to cover the repair payments. Manuel hopes that his job will last since his family is dependent on him.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Janeth Mery

texts.es: La  señora   Janeth  es cliente que se encuentra en su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba, la Sra. Janeth  que se dedica  a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y fideo y variedad de productos tiene un puesto de venta en un mercado concurrido de la ciudad,  vende desde hace ya varios años, el crédito en esta ocasión lo utilizara en  la  compra de arroz, fideo y aceite  y así surtir su puesto de venta,  la señora la Sra. Janeth es un apersona que  paga de manera puntual sus cuotas  ha demostrado responsabilidad hasta el momento ella se compromete  que seguirá  trabajando de manera responsable,  trabaja de manera  muy sacrificada  ya  que quiere salir adelante económicamente y mejorar sus ingresos y por ende la calidad de vida de toda su familia, se siente muy feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Sra. Janeth is a client who is in her second loan cycle with the institution. She lives in the city of Cochabamba. She markets staple necessities such as rice, sugar, noodles and a variety of other items and has a stall in a busy market in the city. She has been selling for several years. On this occasion the loan will enable her to purchase rice, noodles and cooking oil and thus stock her stall.

Janeth is a person who makes her payments punctually and has demonstrated a sense of responsibility. She is committed to continue working in a responsible manner. She makes sacrifices in her work because she wants to get ahead financially and improve her earnings and therefore the quality of life for all of her family. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity provided her.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice and noodles to stock her stall.

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married, and has five children. 

Zaki has been an owner of a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2400 loan in order to expand his market and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to expand his market and add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.ru: Василий женат, имеет двоих детей. Он занимается фермерством - выращивает ранние овощи в теплицах. Имея свою землю и богатый опыт (более 18 лет работы), Василий ведет бизнес успешно. Он знает какие культуры и сорта приносят большую прибыль, поэтому получает максимальную прибыль из вложенных средств. А главное, Василий любит землю и ему нравится этот бизнес. Василий просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 10,000 гривен на закупку пленки, семян и удобрений.
texts.en: Vasiliy is married and has two children.  He is involved in farming and grows early vegetables in greenhouses.  He owns his land and is very experienced (he has been working in this field for more than 18 years), which makes him very successful at his business.  He knows what cultures and crop varieties produce a high yield, and therefore he receives maximum profit from his investments.  But most importantly, Vasiliy loves the land and enjoys his business.  He is requesting a loan of 10,000 hryvnia to buy film, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy film, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 26 years of age and single. She has a business selling peas, spices and other greengrocery items in Nakuru town. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and she plans to use this loan to buy more stock of peas, spices, potatoes and leafy vegetables for sale. 

This will enable her to increase her income and cater for her needs as well. In the future, Serah hopes to expand her business and open a greengrocery store in the market and thereby become one of the leading greengrocery traders in Nakuru.

loans.use: to buy more stock of peas, spices, potatoes and leafy vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Azim

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has two children.

He has owned a bakery since 2000, selling bread and pastries. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His bakery is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to renovate and paint his bakery. He is aiming to earn more profits to give him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and paint his bakery.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 37 years old, and is a fruits and vegetables seller in Kongowea, Mombasa. He is married and a father of two school going children. He has been doing this business for the last three years and he is doing great. 

This is Nicholas’ first business loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more cabbages, oranges, bananas, tomatoes and kale. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to repay his loan. He hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more cabbages, oranges, bananas, tomatoes and kale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and her husband is a NGO worker. Together they have 2 children between the ages of 12 and 15, and they are currently in school and live at home. 

For the past few years Elizabeth has been selling fresh fish in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has more customers. Elizabeth is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh cassava fish, butter nose fish, and bonnie fish for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh cassava fish, butter nose fish, and bonnie fish for her business

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rosario es una madre soltera muy responsable de 34 años de edad, tiene un hijo y cuenta con casa propia la misma que esta ubicada en el caserío rural de nombre “Peñarol” en el Distrito de Tambogrande, a mas de cuatro horas de la Ciudad de Chiclayo, es un caserío pequeño donde por ahora solo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica.
Rosario se dedica a la crianza, engorde y venta de animales menores, como ovinos y caprinos y en su gran mayoría aves de corral, para lo que ya cuenta con su clientes en los diferentes mercados de su caserío, además también cuenta con 1has de terreno agrícola como herencia de su padre en el que ha sembrado limón y cosecha semanalmente.
Ahora ella esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles con el fin de comprar alimento balanceado y a la vez fertilizantes para abonar sus sembrios de limón.
Ella y sus menores hijos son conocidos en su caserío por ser personas muy tratables y amables, pues se han ganado el cariño de todos.
texts.en:
Rosario is a very responsible single mother who is 34 years old. She has one child and has her own house which is located in a rural village named "Peñarol" in the district of Tambogrande, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo. It is a small farm which, for now, has only electric energy service.

Rosario is dedicated to raising, fattening and selling young animals such as sheep and goat and, in the great majority, poultry, for which she already has customers in different markets of her village. Additionally, she also has one hectare of farm land that she inherited from her father  where she has planted lemon and harvests weekly.

Now she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternative for the amount of 1,000 new "soles" with the goal of purchasing feed and, at the same time, fertilizer to fertilize her lemon planting. She and her youngest children are known in their village for being very friendly people and they have earned the affection of everyone.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and feed.

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es: La señora Juana vive en la ciudad de Choluteca,  junto con su hija quien le ayuda en esta actividad , es una persona muy trabajadora  dedicada a su negocio propio lo que es venta de abarrotería en general como ser, maíz, frijoles, pan, embutidos, arroz, azúcar y otros, actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años en la comunidad donde vive, esta ubicada en un punto muy estratégico donde transitan muchas personas,  todos los días se levanta muy temprano para así de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de  cada uno de sus clientes, es muy responsable en cada uno de sus compromisos trabaja fuerte cada día para así de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Esta solicitando crédito por la cantidad de L. 10,000.00, para poder invertirlo en variedad de productos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana lives in the city of Choluteca.  She lives with her daughter, who helps with this business activity.  Juana is a very hard-working person who is devoted to her own business.  She sells general groceries like corn, beans, bread, sausages, rice, sugar, and others.  She has been doing this for eight years in the community where she lives.

It is located at a very strategic spot where a lot of people pass by.  She gets up very early in order to satisfy the needs of each one of her customers.  She is very responsible in each one of her obligations.  She works hard every day so that she will make her business grow and have a better quality of life.

She is requesting a loan for 10,000 lempira to be able to buy a variety of products for her business.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, and eggs for her business.

loans.name: Santa Eduwiges Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre "Santa Eduwiges" los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre, puesto que para ellos esta Santa representa la humildad y la solidaridad, es por eso que decidieron nombrar de esta manera a su grupo, esta historia es acerca del  señor Gerónimo ya que es el representante de este grupo, el cuenta con 69 años de edad y es soltero y no tiene hijos, el se dedica a la venta de maíz y refrescos desde hace mas de 30 años.

Don Gerónimo decidió iniciar con este negocio ya que dice quería buscar la forma de mejorar su calidad de vida y gozar de una solvencia económica más estable, va a invertir su crédito en la compra de mas maíz y refrescos al mayoreo, para así continuar con su negocio.

El sueño que él tiene es el de construir un local para poner una tienda de abarrotes, y así continuar con sus ventas, tenerla mucho mas surtida y con más variedad de productos, puesto que así obtendrá más y mejores ingresos, para con esto asegurar su futuro ya que es mayor de edad.

Don Gero (como mejor lo conocen sus compañeros) está muy agradecido con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron ya que gracias a esto su negocio empezara a mejorar mucho pero sobre todo su vida.

Los integrantes del grupo y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: Adriana-pescadería, Maria-frutería, Geronimo-venta de refrescos, Juliana-molino de nixtamal, Rosalva-venta de refrescos, Cristina-venta de refrescos, Maricela venta de refrescos y Aldegunda-venta de comida.
texts.en:
This group is named Santa Eduwiges.  The members of the group decided to give it this name given that this saint represents humility and solidarity to them.

This story is about Gerónimo because he is the representative of the group.  He is 69 years old, single, and does not have children.  He has been selling corn and soft drinks for over 30 years.  Gerónimo says that he decided to start with this business because he wanted to seek a better quality of life and to enjoy more stable financial solvency.

He will use the loan to buy more corn and soft drinks wholesale in order to continue with his business.

His dream is to build a place to put a grocery store.  This way he would continue with his sales, have the business stocked much more, and have a greater variety of products.  This way he will get more and improved income.  With this he would seure his future because he is elderly.

Gero (as his colleagues know him) is very grateful to the Fundación Realidad and Kiva for the support of the loan they gave him.  Thanks to the loan his business will start to improve a lot, but above all, his life will improve.

The members of the group and their business activities are the following:
Adriana – fish market
Maria – greengrocer
Geronimo – soft drink sales
Juliana – corn flour mill
Rosalva – soft drink sales
Cristina – soft drink sales
Maricela – soft drink sales
Aldegunda – food sales
.

loans.use: to buy more corn and soft drink wholesale.

loans.name: Mattie

texts.en:
Mattie is 47 years old and lives in the Paynesville. She is a widow with three children between the ages of 31 and 18 that are living on their own.

For the past seven years she has been selling rice, oil, and others items in the local market. She makes lots of profit and has many customers. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, and many items for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and many items for her business.

loans.name: Awal

texts.en:
Awal lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for two years. She is 29 years old, married, and has three children. Two of them are in school.
 
Awal heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. 

This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children. All of them are still in school. 

Ayen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer This is her fourth loan from BRAC. 

She has requested a loan of 2000 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Jovanice

texts.en:
Jovanice is married and has six children between 16 and 29 years old. Three of them go to school. Her husband works as a policeman. 

She has been a rice farmer for one year. She would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been using to get more output and pay school fees for the children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds and support labor.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Bor. She runs a food stall and has been in business for two years. She is 35 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are still in school.
 
Rebecca heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. 

She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Sania

texts.en:
Sania is 48 years old. She is married and has four children. 

She sells household goods such as cups, plates and mats to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and hopes to expand her business in the future. 

She has applied for 60,000 KES to buy cups, plates and mats for sale.

loans.use: To buy cups, plates and mats to sell.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba lives in West Point with seven children between 7 and 20 years old.

For years now, she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in her community. She received a little amount from her husband to start her business, and she learned it from her mother.

She likes her business because she makes a good profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish, spare ribs, rice, pig's feet and coal for her  business.

Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, spare ribs, rice, pig's feet and coal for her business.

loans.name: Evasta

texts.en:
Evasta is married with five children between the ages of 13 and 25. All are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a farmer. She has been a rice farmer for 9 years. She would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand her planting area to get more output and put some money into savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Nyangong

texts.en:
Nyangong lives in Bor. She sells at a food stall, and she has been in business for three years. She is 25 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school. 

Nyangong heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 SDG in order to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Najat

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is a 58-year-old widow with one child.

Najat has been a professional tailor for four years. She makes, repairs, and alters clothing, including suits, coats, and women's dresses. She has a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Najat has decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to purchase two tailoring machines and to add more goods to her inventory. She is aiming to earn more profits to improve her family’s life overall.
