loans.use: to purchase two tailoring machines and to add more goods to her inventory.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is married and has two children, age 1 and 2. They are still too young to attend school. His wife works as a farmer. 

He has been a rice farmer for eight years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to get more output and he also plans to renovate the house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, seeds and support labor.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a married, 28-year-old youth client.

Since 2008, Walid has owned a shop where he repairs generators and electrical household items. He has sufficient experience in this field. In addition, he has a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation, and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Walid is requesting a $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to make a sliding door for his shop. He is aiming to earn more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family overall.

loans.use: to pay his annual rent and to add a sliding door to his shop.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 49-year-old farmer. He is a widower with two children. He has been rearing pigs for the past 20 years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Simon will use the loan to buy pig feeds. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to have a big pig farm.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is married. She has three children aged between 12 and 17 and all of them go to school. She has been a rice farmer for 9 years. She would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and for labor support to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been using to get more output and build a house for living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. ` Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and for labor support.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 28-year-old businessman. He is a single man but supports his siblings. He has been selling household utensils for the past three years with the monthly income of 6,000 KES, which he uses to cater to his basic needs.

He is applying for his 2nd loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Samuel will use the loan to buy more plasticware for selling.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will pay school fees for his brother. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing and being a mixed crop farmer.

loans.use: to buy more plasticware for selling

loans.name: Falasten

texts.en:
Falasten is a 34-year-old young woman. She is married and the mother of four sons. Her husband is a worker with a low salary, not enough to cover the family's costs.  Falasten's husband works also in agriculture, which is a profitable project.

Falasten is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband complete the price of purchasing a greenhouse and tractor for agricultural use. This will improve Falasten's husband's work in agriculture and will help him to have a better crop and so increase sales and increase the family's income.

Falasten is photographed with her son on the piece of land the family owns.

loans.use: to complete the price of purchasing a greenhouse and tractor for agricultural use

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.en:
Juvenal is single. He has been a rice farmer for 8 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand his planting area to get more output, to pay his children's school fees, and to build a house for himself.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 51 years old, married, and has five children.

Since 2003, Saad has owned a grocery store, selling different types of fruits and vegetables. He has sufficient experience in this field. He also has a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation, and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to expand and renovate his store. He is aiming to earn more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family overall.

loans.use: to expand and renovate his store.

loans.name: Laurent

texts.en:
Laurent is married with four children aged between 6 and 13. All of them attend schools. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 9 years.

He would like to get this Kiva loan to pay for fertilizers, seeds and labor support to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and build a nice house.

In the picture, Laurent was shown with his fellow borrowers looking from behind.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for fertilisers, seeds and labor support

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 46 years old and from Ndunyu. She has an electronics business which she has been running for the past 12 years. 

Hannah has applied for a loan from KADET Ltd to enable her to buy assorted electrical goods.  She is optimistic that her business will do well after the loan. 

She hopes to expand her business into a large-scale one and this will also ensure that there is improved income which will in turn help improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy assorted electrical goods

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has one child.

Jamal has been an owner of a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a 2,400 USD loan in order to purchase split air conditioner and two fridges. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase split air conditioner and two fridges.

loans.name: Ayom

texts.en:
Ayom lives in Bor. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for one year. She is 31 years old, married, and has three children, two of them are still in school. 

Ayom heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,200 SDG in order to purchase onions and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and rice for sale.

loans.name: Kosay

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married and has four children.

Kosay is a blacksmith. He has owned a workshop since 2009, where he makes doors and windows. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a 2,100 USD loan in order to purchase a large electrical generator for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a large electrical generator for his workshop.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is married with two children, ages between 2 and 12. The oldest attends school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 16 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and support labor.

loans.name: Mutinda

texts.en: Mutinda is 39 years old and married with 4 children. He runs a retail shop to earn income. He has been in the business for 16 years. He also runs a grocery store and does maize farming to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, rice and cooking oil for sale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine, a married mother of a four-month-old child, has been a rice farmer for three years. She would like to receive this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and pay labor costs to get the best harvest possible. With the profits, she plans to increase her rice production and build a good house to live in.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: La Esperanza De San Luis Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "La Esperanza de San Luis" las personas que lo conforman decidieron ponerle este nombre porque así se llama su comunidad, ya que todos pertenecen a la misma, la historia es acerca del señor Antonio cuenta con 33 años de edad y está casado con la señora Teodomira con quien tiene 2 hijos los cuales cursan primero y segundo año de preescolar, el es taxista desde hace mas de 4 años.

Dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio porque quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante y apoyar a su esposa con los gastos de la casa, al igual que para  mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de refacciones (llantas, bugías, aceite, lubricante, etc.) y mantenimiento del taxi.

La meta que tiene Don Toño (como mejor lo conocen en su comunidad) es la de continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan terminar una buena carrera profesional y así tengan un mejor futuro, también quiere hacer crecer mas su pequeño negocio, ya que quiere empezar a ahorrar para comprase otro coche y así mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.

Esta muy agradecido con fundación realidad y los prestatatarios de kiva por el apoyo incondicional que le están brindando, ya que gracias a esta ayuda ha mejorado su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Estos son los nombres de las personas y las actividades a las que se dedican cada una de los integrantes del grupo, Yaneth, Antonio, cristina y francisca quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: taxista, venta de pollos, frutas y verduras, ropa.
texts.en:
This group is called "La Esperanza de San Luis" (The Hope of San Luis), because its members decided to call it after their community, since they all live there.

The following description is about Señor Antonio. He is 33 years old and married to Señora Teodomira, with whom he has two children who attend the first and second year of kindergarten. Antonio has been a taxi driver for more than four years. He says that he decided to start this business, because he wanted to find a way to raise his children and support his wife with household expenses, while improving the quality of life of his family. He will invest his loan in the purchase of spare parts (tires, spark plugs, oil, lubricant, etc.) and the maintenance of his taxi.

The goal of Don Toño (as he is best known in his neighborhood) is to continue supporting his children in their studies, so that they get a good professional career and a better future. He also wants to expand his small business and will save some money to buy another car and thus increase his income. Antonio is very grateful to the microfinance institution Fundación Realidad and the Kiva lenders for their unconditional support, because it has helped him to improve his own quality of life and that of his family.

These are the names and activities of the members of the group: Yaneth, Antonio, Cristina and Francisca; they drive a taxi, sell poultry, sell fruits and vegetables, and sell clothes.

loans.use: to buy spare parts (tires, spark plugs, oil, lubricant, etc.) and have his taxi serviced.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es una mujer de 58 años de edad, ella es tiene un pequeño negocio donde se dedica a la venta de jugos y comida día a día con la finalidad de sacar adelante a su último hijo de 18 años. Rosa es una mujer que tras el fallecimiento de su esposo empezó este tipo de negocio debido a que él era el que traía el sustento para su hogar.

Rosa tiene su propia juguería y restaurant desde hace aproximadamente 4 años, tiempo en el que ha aprendido a satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, ella se encuentra en una calle donde mucha gente transita y es por este motivo que su negocio ha empezado a crecer y consolidarse.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Rosa podrá comprar un extractor, una licuadora, sillas y mesas para que sus clientes se sientan cómodos al visitarla, ella está muy contenta por la ayuda brindada y confía en que todo saldrá bien, con el dinero que empiece a ganar ella podrá maximizar sus ganancias y de esa manera juntar el necesario para iniciar su cadena de restaurantes y dejar a su hijo a cargo como administrador de la misma.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa, 58, operates a small business where she sells food and juices.  She works day in and day out because she wants to give her youngest child, 18, a good start in life.  Rosa started the business after her husband died because she needed an income.

Rosa has operated the business--a restaurant and juice bar--for about 4 years.  She operates the business on a street where there are lots of passers-by and she has learned to meet the needs of her customers.  Consequently, her business is growing and well-established in the neighborhood.

With your help, Rosa will be able to buy a blender, tables, chairs and other supplies for her business.  She is grateful for your help and for your trust.  The investment will allow her to maximize her earnings and, consequently, save toward her future goal: she wants to open more restaurants and set her son up to manage them.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food stall.

loans.name: Veronika Katherine

texts.es:
Veronika es una mujer de 34 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de pescado, en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Pisco, con el fin de generar los ingresos que necesita para poder cuidar de su pequeño de 4 años. Veronika ama mucho a su pequeño y es por él que lucha día a día.

Ella aprendió este tipo de negocio gracias a su madre, la misma que se dedicaba anteriormente también a este tipo de negocio y es allí donde Veronika aprendió a realizar las compras necesarias, el corte de los pescados, el precio a los que debía venderlos, entre otras cosas. Fue con ayuda de unos ahorros y el a sus familiar que pudo abrir este negocio, ella está muy contenta con la labor que realiza y está segura de lo que hace.

Veronika ya tiene 9 años en este negocio y sabe que está ubicada en un lugar estratégico dentro del terminar pesquero, lo que le permite vender mucho más, también ha detectado que los pescadores siempre alquilan algunas redes, es por este motivo que su crédito la ayudará a comprar algunas de estas redes y otros accesorios para poder alquilarlos y generar un ingreso extra. Ella sabe que también debe comprar otro tipo de pescados (Jurel, Bonito, Lenguado, Pintadilla, entre otros) para que así pueda captar aún más la atención de sus clientes y ofrecerles todo tipo de productos.

Veronika está muy contenta por el apoyo brindado y está segura que con esto podrá construir su vivienda a base de material noble debido a que actualmente está hecha por cañas y un módulo de madera.
texts.en:
Veronika, 34, operates a business buying and selling fish.  She operates the business at the fish market in Pisco.  She wants to generate an income so that she can support her her 4-year old son.  Veronika loves her little boy very much and it's for him that she works.

Veronika learned how to buy and sell fish from her mother who operated a similar business.  She learned how to clean fish, what price to charge and everything else.  She started the business with her own savings and with help from her family.  She is very happy with the business.

Veronika has operated the business for 9 years.  It's located in a good spot, inside the fish market, something that helps her sales.  She noticed that many fishermen rent nets so she's applying for a loan to buy nets and other equipment that she will, in turn, rent to generate an extra income.  She also wants to buy other kinds of fish (jurel, bonito, lenguardo, pintadilla, etc.) so that she can draw in more customers.

Veronika says that she is grateful for your help.  She is sure that the investment will generate the income she needs to meet her goal of building a sturdier, safer house.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment that she will rent and merchandise that she will resell.

loans.name: Cristina Sternao

texts.es:
Cristina, quiere seguir trabajando con préstamo, por eso inicia nuevamente el tramite, porque quiere comprarse algunos productos para la elaboración de las pupusas, como el maíz, tomates, repollo, aceite, condimentos, leña, gas, ya que esto le permite tener disponibilidad para aumentar la producción.
Ella considera tener un efecto positivo del préstamo anterior, en el cual invirtió todo el préstamo para lograr estabilizar el negocio, manifiesta que cuenta con una mejor solvencia económica, pues este es su segundo prestamo.
texts.en:
Cristina wants to continue borrowing money to support her business.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy supplies--maize, tomatoes, cabbage, cooking oil, condiments, firewood, cooking gas--for her food business.  The investment will help her to increase her production.
Cristina says that a previous loan helped her get started.  She used it to establish the business and now she wants a second loan to grow it.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her food business.

loans.name: Alba Judith

texts.es:
Alba, se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de comales, ollas y sartenes, su compra será en barro, leña $50.00, nacazcol $30.00, transporte $60.00 más otros insumos que son necesarios, de los cuales no se establece montos por su variedad en el precio, pero que si invertirá.
Ella considera que a través del primer préstamo su negocio mejoro en la producción, siendo hoy más rentable y generándole lo necesario para abarcar las necesidades de la familia.
texts.en:
Alba is applying for a loan that she will use to buy materials and services--clay, firewood, charcoal, transport, etc.-- for making tortilla pans, pots and other products.  She doesn't know exactly how much everything will cost, because of price changes, but she will buy what she immediately needs.
Alba used her first loan to establish her business.  It's profitable now and generating enough income to support her family.

loans.use: to supplies for her crafts business.

loans.name: Yuol

texts.en:
Yuol lives in Bor. She sells food from a stall and has been in business for four years. 

She is 32 year old, married and has six children.  Four attend school. 

This is her second loan from BRAC.  Yuol heard about BRAC South Sudan from its credit officer.  She has requested a loan of 800 to purchase beans and sugar.  

Yuol will use extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar.

loans.name: Masimba Group

texts.en:
Netsai, 40, is from Mutare.  She is married with five children, three attend school.  

Netsai runs a retail business selling clothes. Her business has been in operation for 5 years.  She says her main challenge is high customs duty fees. 

Netsai has requested a loan of $800 to buy clothes to resell.  

She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will help her support her family.  In the future Netsai plans to own a clothes shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Fotunato Modesto

texts.es:
El señor Fortunato es un hombre de 55 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de ropa, este negocio le permite poder sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos, el mayor de 18, el segundo de 16 y la menor de 7 años, actualmente el solo se hace cargo de sus pequeños debido a que su esposa decidió marcharse del hogar.

Fortunato empezó como recorredor en la venta de ropa y como muestra de su gran dedicación ahora tiene un local propio donde netamente vende este tipo de productos a distinto tipo de público, Fortunato ésta muy feliz con el desarrollo de su negocio.

Actualmente el desea poder comprar algunas nuevas prendas de vestir, uniformes escolares, mochilas, camisas, entre otros, debido a que es estos tiempos donde se realizan las mayores ventas para los niños que van al colegio y es esta temporada donde Fortunato quiere aprovechar teniendo todos los productos a su alcance, es por este motivo que solicito el préstamo y está seguro que venderá mucho más debido a que ya ha visto el incremento de los compradores durante estos últimos 6 años en esta temporada escolar.

El desea algún día tener una gran tienda y cumplir con el compromiso que tiene con sus hijos, convertirlos en grandes profesionales y que siempre estén bien de salud.
texts.en:
Sr. Fortunato, 55, operates a clothing sales business.  The business allows him to support his 3 children who are 18-, 16- and 7-years old, respectively.  His wife abandoned the family, so he has sole responsibility for the children now.

Fortunato was a street vendor before, but he eventually saved enough money to open his own store.  He tells us that he is very happy with the business now.  

Fortunato wants to expand by adding a wider range of products--school uniforms, backpacks, shirts, etc.--because there is a lot of demand for school-related products now that the new school year has started.  He is applying for a loan to buy more products and he's sure the investment will increase his sales because of the demand he's seen from his customers over the last 6 months.

Fortunato would like to have a larger store one day so that he can better provide for his children.  He says that he wants them to study for paid careers and to always enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his clothing sales business.

loans.name: Edouard

texts.en:
Edouard is married with five children, age six to 23.  All are enrolled in school.  He has been a rice farmer for four years.  His wife works as a farmer.  

He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get a good harvest. 

With the profits, he plans to expand the land he has been using to get more output and to renovate his house.

---------------------------

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get a good harvest.

loans.name: Phillipe

texts.en:
Phillipe is married with five children ages one to 10.  All are enrolled in school.  His wife works as a farmer.  He has been a rice farmer for 2 years. 

He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest possible.  

With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming to get more output.

-----------------------------

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest possible.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 48 years old business lady.  She is a widow with three children.  Elizabeth has been selling cereal for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family.

Elizabeth is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Elizabeth will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for selling. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children.  Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy dry maize and beans for selling.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 49 years old business man.  He is married to Teresia, a farmer.  They are blessed with one child.  He has been operating a motorcycle transport company for the past two years, with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully.  Fredrick will use the loan to buy a motorbike. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a taxi car.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de dos cerdos, ya que su intensión es mantener la granja y con ella a los clientes para obtener ingresos para su familia.
Ella considera haber tenido una buena experiencia con el préstamo anterior, que sus condiciones económicas van mejorando a través de su trabajo y los financiamientos que ha tenido.
texts.en: María is asking for a new loan to buy two pigs because her intention is to maintain her farm and with it the customers needed to earn family income.  She feels that she's had a good experience with the previous loan; her economic conditions are improving through her work and the loans she's had.

loans.use: to buy two pigs.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Chrisophe

texts.en:
Chrisophe has been a rice farmer for 5 years.  He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest.  With the profits, he plans to expand the land area that he has been using to get more output.  He is engaged to be married and also wants to renovate his house and save money.

----------------------------------------

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest.

loans.name: Laura Esperanza

texts.es: Laura es una mujer de47 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su confecciones su historia empezó desde que tenía 17 años me gusto la costura lo escogí porque me gusta manejar prendas de vestir, su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es ser un modista y lo mejor para mi familia que nunca le falte nada. Por eso quiere el préstamo para sus confecciones.
texts.en: Laura is a 47 year old woman who hopes to become more prosperous through her creations in the coming years. Her story began when she was seventeen years old. “I liked to sew, and I chose it because I enjoy making clothes.” She works by herself, and has difficulties, such as late-payments, the fact that she is not married, and that she has children. Her most important dream is to work in fashion, and “to provide the best for my family so that they never want for anything.” For these reasons she is requesting the loan for her creations.

loans.use: to acquire sewing articles, such as threads and fabric.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro, nuevamente solicita un nuevo préstamo debido a la época lluviosa que se acerca,  lo utilizara para remodelar el techo su vivienda y comprar los materiales como: lamina, madera, clavos con el objetivo de que su familia viva en mejores condiciones y este más segura.
El préstamo anterior lo utilizo en cubrir algunos gastos básicos de educación de sus hijos y dandole la oportunidad de apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Mauro is once again asking for la new loan because the rainy season is approaching; he will use it to replace the roof on his house and to buy materials like sheets of metal, wood and nails with the objective of providing better living conditions and more safety for his family.  He used the previous loan to cover some of his children's basic education costs giving him the opportunity to support his children.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal, wood and nails.

loans.name: Flor Margarita

texts.es: Flor es una mujer de 43 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su librería y tienda su historia empezó desde que necesitaba incrementar mas sus ingresos y comenzó a vender hojas cuadernos luego una  amiga lo animo a vender más cosas y comenzó con jugos y colas, su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es mejorar su casa y tener un negocio. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su librería y tienda.
texts.en: Flor is a 43-year-old woman who has many hopes for her stationery shop and general store's progress in the next few years.  Her story started when she needed to increase income and she began to sell loose leaf notebook paper.  Later, a girl friend encouraged her to sell more things and she started to sell juice and sodas.  She works alone and has problems with street crime.  She's married and has children.  Her most important dream is to do some home improvements and to have a business which is why she wants the loan for her stationery shop and store.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, loose leaf paper and supplies for the store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Iraq.  He is 29 years old, married and has two children.

Ahmad sells different types of wood.  He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation, and is becoming well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop.  He is aiming to gain more profits, and hopes to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Blanca Damaris

texts.es:
Blanca Damaris, tiene 34 años de edad, casada con dos hijos de 14 y 18 años de edad, quienes están estudiando, vive en el Barrio Trincheras de Choloma, Cortes.
Ella tiene 7 años aproximadamente de dedicarse a su propio negocio, donde vende productos de catalogo de Avon y productos Arabela, de todo tipo de cosméticos y aretes, cadenas, anillos y pulseras en enchape, oro y plata. Inició este negocio con fondos propios, se motivo porque le llamo la atención el tipo de negocio y porque deja buenas ganancias. Sus ventas son de manera ambulante y por pedidos y entrega a domicilio, al que le dedica 5 horas diarias. 
Esta solicitando este préstamo de 15,000.00 Lempiras, para comprar cosméticos, y productos de enchape, oro y plata para mantener surtido el negocio, para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Su idea es seguir creciendo con el negocio y lograr que sus hijos se gradúen en la universidad.
texts.en:
Blanca Damaris, 34, is married and has two children who are 14 and 18 years old and are attending school.  She lives in Barrio Trincheras de Choloma, Cortes.  She’s been working in her own business for about 7 years; she sells Avon and Arabela products via catalogue.  She sells all types of cosmetics and gold-plated, gold and silver earrings, chains, rings and bracelets.  She started this business with her own funds.  She was motivated because this type of business attracted her attention and because it produces good profits.  She works five hours daily.

She is asking for this 15,000.00 Lempira loan to buy cosmetics and gold plated, gold and silver items to have a good selection available for her customers.  Her idea is to continue growing in business and for her children to manage to graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni is a 36 years old business woman, who lives in Juba.  She is married and has 8 children between the ages of 21 and 3.  All attend school. 

Poni has run a food store business for 3 years.  She has no employees.  

Poni heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients, outreach and promotion done by loan officers.  

She is requesting a loan of 1500 to purchase more food items like tomatoes, onions and more.  In additions to this business; Poni runs a motorcycle business, as other source of additional income.

In 5 years time, Poni would like her business to grow and to purchase at least two motorbikes.

Her major challenges include her low income at the moment, school fees and home expenses. 

Poni says, she is happy that Finance Sudan supports women, to help them with capital to start up small businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like tomatoes, onions and more.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque le ayudara a mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio, para atender la demanda de los clientes, lo utilizara en salchichas, aderezos, jamon, repollo, pan, pues con este préstamo su negocio aumentara la elaboracion de los hot dog y tendra más ganancias, siendo más provechoso.
La condición de Ana, ha mejorado mucho, porque ha sabido manejar las ganancias que le genera el negocio, además que su familia le apoya y colabora para crecer.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan because it will help her to improve availability for her business. To attend to her customers’ requests, she will use the loan to purchase sausage, seasonings, ham, cabbage, and bread. With this loan, her business will increase its hot dog production, have more revenue, and be more profitable.
Ana’s condition has improved a great deal because she has been able to manage the revenue her business generates. Additionally, her family supports and helps her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase sausage, seasonings, ham, and cabbage.

loans.name: Liliana Victoria

texts.es:
Liliana de 26 años de edad, tiene una máquina de confección donde puede realizar confecciones de cortinas, forros para muebles, arreglos y composturas. El motivo por el que decidió poner este tipo de negocio se debe que fue su esposo el que aprendió a trabajar con mucho empeño y dedicación en el taller de un amigo suyo, mientras que Liliana siempre se dedico a ahorrar para que en algún momento pusieran su negocio propio.

Hace algún tiempo terminaron de pagar su máquina de costura y han aprendió mucho más sobre este tipo de negocio, es algo que a ambos les ha gustado bastante y sobre todo es un negocio netamente familiar, motivo por el cual están felices, debido a que no soplo pueden trabajar juntos, sino que también generan los ingresos necesarios para su pequeña Maria Ángeles de 8 años, la que les trae buenas calificaciones del colegio y es muy obediente con ellos, la niña por la que decidieron ser independientes y principal fuente de energía para ellos.

Actualmente ellos necesitan comprar una maquina remalladora y telas nuevas para la confección de algunas cortinas, estas ganancias les permitirán mejorar la educación de su hija, tener más clientes y en algún tiempo abrir otro taller de confección.
texts.en:
Liliana, 26, has a sewing machine that she can use to make curtains, furniture covers, decorations and repairs.  The reason why she decided to set up this type of business is that her husband learned how to work hard and with dedication at a friend’s shop while Liliana always concentrated on saving so that they could some day open a business of their own.

Some time ago they finished paying off their sewing machine and have learned much more about this type of business; it’s something they’ve both liked very much above all because it’s a complete family business which makes them very happy because not only have they been able to work together but have also been able to generate income needed for their little 8-year-old girl, María Ángeles, who gets good grades in school and is very obedient with her parents.  Their little girl is their main source of energy and the reason why they decided to become independent.

They currently need to buy an overlock sewing machine and new fabric to make curtains.  Profits will allow them to improve their daughter’s education, to have more customers and in time open another sewing shop.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and new fabric.

loans.name: Kathuska Annabelle

texts.es: Kathuska es una mujer de 21 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de ropa su historia empezó con la ayuda de su mama sola con la venta de ropa por catalogo de ahí luego ella comenzó a ahorrar e hizo un préstamo y comprar mas mercadería, su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es seguir con su negocio y ser profesional y ayudar a su hijo. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de ropa de mujer y hombres
texts.en: Kathuska is a 21-year-old woman and the has many aspirations for the coming years of prospering in her clothing sales.  Her story began with only the help of her mother selling clothing from catalogs.  From there, she began to save and took out a loan to buy more merchandise.  She does her work on her own and the difficulty  she faces is crime.  She isn't married; she has children; and her most important dream is to keep going with her business and to be professional and to help her son.  That is why she wants this loan for her sales of men's and women's clothing.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's clothing

loans.name: Wendy Alexandra

texts.es: Wendy es una mujer de 31 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de comida rápida su historia empezó hace 2 años se viene desempeñado en la venta de comida rápida junto a su esposo que laboraba como pollicero y ahora lo hace junto a ella, su trabajo lo hace junto a su esposo, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está en unión libre, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es abrir otro local y ella atenderlo que su familia pueda hacer y sus hijos puedan ayudarla en el negocio mas adelante. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de comida rápida y asi comprar carnes, vegetales, granos.
texts.en: Wendy is a 31 year old woman who has many hopes for her fast food business’ progress in the next few years.  Her story began two years ago.  She’s been selling fast food with her husband who used to work raising chickens but now works with her.  She works with her husband and has difficulty with street crime.  She’s in a common law relationship and has children.  Her greatest wish is to open another locale to run herself and that her family can also work there and later on her children can help her with the business too.  Because of this she wants the loan for her fast food sales; she will buy meat, vegetables and grains.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables and grains.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque considera que le ayudan para el desarrollo de su trabajo, estos fondos los utilizara en la compra de telas, cuero, para la tapicería de muebles y vehículos, esto le ayudara para tener lo suficiente en material para realizar el trabajo de calidad.
Anteriormente Sergio solicito para comprar materiales, ya que su ingreso para subsistir lo recibe de los trabajos que realiza con la tapicería.
texts.en:
Sergio is requesting a new loan because he believes it will help him to develop his business. He will use the funds to purchase fabric and leather to upholster furniture and vehicles. The loan will help him to have sufficient materials to do quality work. 
Earlier, Sergio requested a loan to purchase materials because the earnings he receives from his upholstery work allow him to subsist.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and leather to upholster furniture and vehicles.

loans.name: Benedicto Elias

texts.es:
Benedicto es un hombre de 44 años que es albañil y se dedica a la construcción de distintas obras en la ciudad de Chincha, Perú. El se inició en este tipo de negocio porque sus amigos lo animaron a que aprendiera a cómo construir y así poder generar los ingresos que necesitaba para cuidar bien de sus 3 pequeños hijos.

Actualmente le va bien en su negocio, con el tiempo ha podido comprar algunas herramientas y así ha podido desempeñarse mejor, el trabaja a partir de las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, tiempo en el que atiende a un promedio de 2 a 3 clientes. El sabe que siempre tiene trabajo porque sus clientes están contentos por la buena labor que realiza y además tiene buenos acabados en las construcciones.

Benedicto desea comprar una moladora, lo que le permitirá facilitar su trabajo y además de ello hacer mejores construcciones, es por este motivo que ha solicitado un préstamo, está muy contento con la ayuda brindada y la confianza en su persona, el desea generar mejor ingresos y así cumplir nuevas metas, como comprar una mezcladora, pieza fundamental para la labor que realiza y junto con ello construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Benedicto is a 44-year-old man who is a builder and he works on different construction projects in the city of Chincha, Peru.  He started out in this kind of business because his friends encouraged him to learn how to build and thereby be able to make the income he needed to take good care of his three small children.

His business is currently going well.  As time has passed, he's been able to buy some tools and so he's been able to perform his work better.  He works from eight in the morning until seven at night, during which time he sees an average of two or three clients.  He knows that he will always have work because his clients are happy with the good work he does and also because he does good finishing work on his construction projects.

Benedicto wants to buy a grinder, which will make his work easier and which will also allow him to make better structures.  This is why he has asked for a loan.  He is very happy with the help he has received and the trust that has been put in him as a person.  He wants to make more income so he can reach new goals, such as buying a mixer, which is a fundamental piece of equipment for the work he does and which he can use to build his own home.

loans.use: to buy a grinder

loans.name: Angel Maria

texts.es:
Ángel, solicita otro préstamo con la intención de incrementar en el inventario de su negocio y debido a la demanda de sus clientes comprara mercadería de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y lo demás lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos para engordarlos y venderlos con eso mejorara sus ingresos.
Ella comenta que nuestra institución le ha brindado muy buena atención y ha podido lograr solventar las necesidades básicas y mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Ángel is asking for another loan to increase inventory in her business because of customer demand to buy women's, men's and children's clothes; she will also use it to buy pigs to fatten up and sell thus improving her income.  She comments that our institution has given her very good service and she's been able to cover basic needs and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy clothes and pigs.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana, de nuevo solicita un  préstamo el cual lo utilizara en comprar los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de tortillas como el maíz, gas propano y una plancha para hacer tortillas de esa manera podrá crecer en su negocio teniendo lo necesario para continuar con su produccion y generar más ganancias.
Ella menciona que el préstamo anterior le ayudo porque mejoro en su negocio y tambien su familia ha mejorado económicamente.
texts.en: Juana is once again asking for a loan that she'll use to buy the necessary supplies to make tortillas like corn, propane gas and a griddle to make the tortillas so that her business can grow having what's necessary to continue with production and generating more profits.  She mentions that her previous loan helped her because she improved her business and her entire family has improved economically.

loans.use: to buy corn, gas and a griddle to make tortillas.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo, por la buena atención de nuestra institución se ha decidido a otro préstamo para aumentar en su negocio de medicina el cual le ayudara para obtener mejores resultados en la venta y de esa forma lograra tener más ingresos, los productos que compra son variados, productos medicinales, suplementos alimenticios, pastillas para dolores menores, vitaminas, sueros.
El menciona que con el prestamo anterior logro mejorar en sus ventas y le permitió mejorar sus condiciones de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en: Thanks to the good attention Ricardo has gotten from our institution he's decided on another loan to increase his business selling medicine which will help him obtain better sales results and thus earn more income.  The products he'll buy are varied: medicinal products, nutritional supplements, pills to treat minor pain, vitamins and serums.  He mentions that his previous loan allowed him to improve sales and improve living conditions for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy pills, vitamins and serums.

loans.name: Jacinta Magdalena

texts.es: Jacinta es una mujer de 23 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de ropa y cosméticos su historia empezó porque las oportunidades de trabajo son pocos y no tenia como trabajar mi hermana me ayudo en esto y empecé con la venta de productos y ropa, su trabajo lo hace sola, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no está casada solo tiene pareja, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es crecer como persona salir adelante y que mis hijos sean profesionales. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en: Jacinta is a twenty-three year old woman who hopes to become more prosperous through her clothing and cosmetics sales in the coming years. Her story began because there are few opportunities to work and she did not have any. “My sister helped me with this and I began to sell products and clothing.” She works by herself, and has difficulties, such as late payments, the fact that she is not married, although she does have a companion, and she has children. Her most important dream is to grow as a person, to get ahead, and “that my children have professional careers.” This is why she is requesting the loan for her clothing and cosmetics sales.

loans.use: to acquire clothing and cosmetics and improve her business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo, ya que está iniciando los cultivos de maíz y pipián, para esto necesita utilizar el préstamo en el alquilar del terreno, donde posteriormente estará trabajando, él considera que a través de estos préstamos ha logrado mantener la producción del cultivo, ya que se le proporciona el dinero necesario para comprar los materiales y realizar su labor.
texts.en: José has decided to request a new loan since he is beginning to plant corn and chili peppers. For this reason he needs to use the loan to rent land, where later he will be working. He believes that through these loans he has managed to maintain his crop production, especially since the loans provide him with the money he needs to purchase materials and to do his work.

loans.use: to rent land.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a window with five children. They live in Nchuabuh, an area in Mankon Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced challenges in life such as the death of her parents which made her drop out of school. The death of her children and death of her husband made things worse for her since they were supportive of her. With this big loss, she was unable to provide for the family's basic needs. 

With the new loan that she has requested she promises to buy a grinding machine, and also engage in farming as well as small trading with items like tomatoes. She thinks her business will succeed because she has a good business site, there is a scarcity of grinding machines in her area of residence, she has regular customers and a good relationship with her customers, and also people in her community will not travel long distances in search of a grinding mill.

She promises that the profit from the loan will be used to pay her children's school fees, purchase medication for the family, expand her business and also to cultivate vegetables for the family to eat. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rate, the training courses that are offered before loam disbursement and the convenient payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase a grinding machine and tomatoes.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine has five children, all of whom go to school. She has been a rice farmer for one year. She would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and  labor support to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been using in order to get more output and make enough for savings.  In the back of the picture are fellow agriculture borrowers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and labor support.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has five children. She runs an insurance firm which has been in operation for the last three years.

Margaret learnt of Milango from her friends and joined in order to access credit. She is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to renovate the office and purchase chairs. Her only challenge is the seasonal business climate and that at times, it is difficult to find clients. Margaret looks forward to extending her operations and will save the additional income realized from her business.

loans.use: To renovate the office and purchase chairs.

loans.name: Faleoo

texts.en:
Faleoo is 41 years old and married with 8 children. She owns and operates a small business venture, selling food products to people in her community. She has doing in this business for 3 years.

Faleoo will use this loan of WST 1500, to purchase ingredients needed to make additional food products for sale. She will use the profits to continue improving and expanding her business, and to support her family. This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food products for sale

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged twenty-seven, married and has one child.

Kareem has owned a fabric shop since 2008, selling a selection of clothing fabric and sewing accessories. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to buy a split air conditioner and showcases. He is aiming to gain more profits, which will offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a split air conditioner and showcases.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a thirty-year-old business woman, who lives in Juba. She is married and has five children between the ages of eleven and two. Four of them go to school. 

Mary runs a food store business, and she has been in the business for eight years. She has no employees. Mary heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients and outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of SDG 2,000 to purchase more food items like tomatoes, Irish potatoes, black pepper, onions, and many others. Mary has no other source of income aside from this business.

In five years time, Mary would like to hope that her business grows, and that she can build a house. Her major challenges include her low income and the fact that it is expensive to rent a house in Juba. 

Mary says that she is happy for the support of Finance Sudan, and that it is received with many thanks.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like tomatoes, Irish potatoes, black pepper and onions.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married with seven children aged between eleven and twenty-four. All his children attend school. He has been a rice farmer for two years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pay for labor to help him get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been planting to get more out, and also pay school fees for the children. Behind Emmanuel in the picture are other borrowers. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pay for additional labor costs.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is married with eight children between five and twenty-three. All of them attend school. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for fifteen years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pay additional labor to help him to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been planting to get more out, and pay school fees for the children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pay for additional labor costs.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel has three children between 6 and 12 years old. All go to school.  Emmanuel has been a rice farmer for 6 years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and labor support to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and labor support.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne has four children who are between 7 and 19 years old. All go to school. She has been a rice farmer for one year. She would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and labor support to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been using to get more output and pay school fees for the children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and  labor support.

loans.name: Theresphore

texts.en:
Theresphore is married and has three children between 7 and 19 years old. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 5 years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and labor support to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and pay school fees for the children.

Behind the picture, there other agriculture borrowers sitting and others standing looking.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and labor support.

loans.name: Tuli

texts.en: Tuli is 48 years old and married with 2 children.  She has a small plantation where she grows a variety of crops and harvests them for sale.  She has been doing this business for a year. Tuli will use this loan of WST 1000 to purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxome, to help her crops grow better.  She will use the profits from her sales, to continue to improve her land and to support her family. This is her first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weedkillers to help her crops grow

loans.name: Nive

texts.en:
Nive is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She owns & operates a business venture, selling dried goods in the local community.  She has one year's experience in this business.    Nive needs a loan of WST $1000 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the profit (estimated to be 250 talas per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2012, Nive joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Nive's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried goods for sale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is from Cagay-anon, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Evelyn is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a pig raising business venture. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns 2,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Evelyn joined Kiva's partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Lydia is married. To make a living, Lydia plants, harvests and sells rice for a living. Lydia has been in her business for 30 years and earns 3,500 PHP a month for these activities. Lydia is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2007, Lydia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lukundo Group

texts.en:
Bryson, who is in his mid-30's, is married and has two children.  One of them is going to school and another one is still small.  Bryson has been running a business of selling fish at wholesale prices and also selling traditional chicken, which he collects from upcountry.  He works from 6.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans for house expenses, to increase his fish stock and to start selling traditional chicken.  He has paid back his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to increase the fish stock and more traditional chicken and to sell chicken in another place. His dream is to be able to build his own house some day.

He will share this loan with his loan group 'Lukundo", which has a total of 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase his fish stock and more traditional chicken, and to sell chicken in another place.

loans.name: April Rose

texts.en: April Rose is a married woman with two children. April Rose is 24 years old, residing at Taboo, Jimenez, Mis. Occ., Philippines.   She owns & operates a fish selling business to earn a living, which she has been doing for two years.  Each month, she earns 2,000 running the business. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional fish to sell.   April Rose joined GDMPC in the year 2012.  In the future, April Rose wants to build a house and hopes her children finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for sale.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is married with 2 children.  She is 56-years-old and lives in the Philippines.

Maxima is a farmer and she operates a coconut & rice production to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 20 years and every month she earn 5,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of 8,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure for her farm.

Maxima has been a member of GDMPC for 4 years. In the future, Maxima hopes that her children complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 51 years of age, managing a rice and hog fattening supply business in the village. She has been operating this business for three years and is very happy for the appreciation of her villagers. She hopes to expand her business. Milagros is asking for additional working capital from ASKI.

A 20,000 PHP loan from ASKI would be used to purchase feeds, like B-Meg and Pigrolac as well as a different kind of rice. She hopes that the hoped for profits from her loan will provide her with greater income. Then she would be able to send all of her 4 children to school and be lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, like B-Meg and Pigrolac as well as a different kind of rice

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou owns and manages a small sari-sari store in her village. This is her way of helping her husband in gaining income to satisfy their family needs and support the education of their two children who are now at college level. Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, Marilou aims to improve her store to increase her income. 

But due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional of P6,000 to buy soft drinks, breads, beverages, soaps, canned goods, noodles and seasonings to sell. She believes that this loan will help her to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand. She is hoping that her business will grow and become a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads, beverages, soaps, canned goods, noodles and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
This is Lucia, thirty, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is a single parent and a mother of three children. She manages her household together with her children, while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lucia maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products from the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers can get as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Lucia fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is from the village of Saranay. She is fifty-six years old, married, and has four children. Adoracion owns and operates a direct selling business, which sells clothing and shoe products in the local community. Adoracion has been engaged in her business for over three years.

As of now, Adoracion is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items such as shoes, lotion and clothing to expand her product offering.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as shoes, lotion and clothing to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto is 59 years old.  He is married and has one child. Ernesto is engaged in a direct selling business.  He has been in his business for ten years. He usually sells clothes and shoes in his village. Right now, Ernesto wants a loan of P40,000 to buy new items, such as clothes and shoes, to sell in the village. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further develop his business.

loans.use: to buy new items, such as clothes and shoes, to sell in the village

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is thirty-eight, married, and has three school-age children. Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband plan to continue sending their children to school and to give them a better life.  Maribel is involved in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. She has been in this business for almost three years earning a profits of PHP 8,000 a month that she usually spends on food and allowances for the children.  

She aimed to raise more pigs to sell but due to insufficient capital, she is requesting an additional PHP 6,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising. She believes that she will be able to improve her business through patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising.

loans.name: Zaitun

texts.en:
Zaitun is forty-eight years old and a mother of eight children. She runs a cafeteria to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and employs two people. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to educate her children and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy beans, rice, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, maize flour and cooking oil.
